issueDTO.title: Update status tag accessibility guidance to reflect new role behaviour
issueDTO.description:

The behavior of status tags has been updated in ui-kit issue 20. It now has enhanced accessibility features that needs to be reflected in guidance.

Specifically inform devs that there is an aria-live role on status tags, so when they render or their inner text changes it is announced to users (confirm that this is the behaviour)

To describe the new functionality so that users can understand and benefit from it.

issueDTO.title: Add Missing docstrings to src/hiero_sdk_python/tokens/custom_fractional_fee.py
issueDTO.description:
🆕🐥 Good first Issue

This issue is reserved for people who have never or only recently contributed to [Hiero](https://hiero.org) or any open source project in general. We know that creating a pull request (PR) is a major barrier for new contributors.
The goal of this issue and all other issues labeled by [**'good first issue'**](https://github.com/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+org%3Ahiero-ledger+archived%3Afalse+label%3A%22good+first+issue%22+) is to help you make your first contribution to Hiero.

## 👾 Description of the issue

Currently  in the [custom_fractional_fee.py](https://github.com/hiero-ledger/hiero-sdk-python/blob/main/src/hiero_sdk_python/tokens/custom_fractional_fee.py) file some methods are missing doc string:

    def set_numerator(self, numerator: int) -> "CustomFractionalFee":
    def set_denominator(self, denominator: int) -> "CustomFractionalFee":
    def set_min_amount(self, min_amount: int) -> "CustomFractionalFee":
    def set_max_amount(self, max_amount: int) -> "CustomFractionalFee":
    def set_assessment_method(self, assessment_method: FeeAssessmentMethod) -> "CustomFractionalFee":
    def _to_proto(self) -> "custom_fees_pb2.CustomFee":
    def _from_proto(cls, proto_fee) -> "CustomFractionalFee":

We are also missing a descriptive class docstring and module docstring.

## 💡 Solution
Add Google-style docstrings. 

For the missing docstrings for the functions, the docstrings should explain:

- What the function does
- Arguments (Args:) ??? their types and purpose
- Returns (Returns:) ??? what the function returns
- Raises (Raises:) ??? any errors or exceptions that might be raised

You can follow the examples of other functions in the SDK ([token_allowance.py](https://github.com/hiero-ledger/hiero-sdk-python/blob/main/src/hiero_sdk_python/tokens/token_allowance.py))

Similarly for the class and the module docstring 

## Acceptance Criteria:
- [ ] All functions have a google-style docstring
- [ ] The class has a google-style docstring
- [ ] the module has a google-style docstring

### Implementation
- [ ] Add google style docstrings throughout

### Additional requirements to Pass
- [ ] Short but descriptive changelog entry under 'UNRELEASED'
- [ ] Verified commits achieved (see CONTRIBUTING.md and signing.md)

### Next steps
  - [ ] Comment below that you???d like to work on this issue.
  - [ ] Wait to be assigned by a maintainer.
  - [ ] Read [CONTRIBUTING.md](https://github.com/hiero-ledger/hiero-sdk-python/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md)
 to start forking and developing.


If you have never contributed to an open source project at GitHub, the following step-by-step guide will introduce you to the workflow.
More information and concrete samples for shell commands for each step can be found in our [CONTRIBUTING.md](https://github.com/hiero-ledger/.github/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md)
 file.
A more detailed general documentation of the GitHub PR workflow can be found [here](https://github.com/firstcontributions/first-contributions/blob/master/README.md)
.

For Python-specific contributing guidelines, see:

[CONTRIBUTING.md](https://github.com/hiero-ledger/hiero-sdk-python/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md)

[README.md](https://github.com/hiero-ledger/hiero-sdk-python/blob/main/README.md)

issueDTO.title: remove `icon` variant from button examples
issueDTO.description:
### Summary

The `icon` variant of icon buttons can be removed from examples on the site.

Internally `icon` is now mapped to `icon-tertiary` and will be removed completely in v4.

The examples could be updated sooner though to remove them and encourage people to use the `icon-tertiary` instead 

One example is https://design.sis.gov.uk/components/button/code#icon-button 

But implementor should review any other examples


### 🚨 Urgency (low, medium or high)
medium

- Low = Does not have significant impact and can be addressed at a convenient time without causing delays.
- Medium = Has moderate impact and should be addressed soon to avoid potential delays or complications.
- High = A critical issue which has significant impact and needs immediate attention to prevent major delays or blockers.
-->

issueDTO.title: Bug : Blog cards and titles not clickable
issueDTO.description: ## Issue: Blog card/title clicks do not open blog page only "Read More" works ### Description: When viewing the Blogs list, clicking the blog card, the blog title, or the blog image does not open the blog post page. Only the "Read More" button navigates to the post. Users expect the whole card (or at least the title/image) to be clickable. ### Steps to reproduce: 1. Go to /blogs 2. Click the title, image, or any blank area inside a blog card (not the "Read More" button) 3. Observe that nothing happens ### Actual behavior: Only the "Read More" button opens the blog post page. ### Expected behavior: Clicking the card, title, or image should navigate to the blog post page (same destination as the "Read More" button). Keyboard users should also be able to focus and press Enter/Space to open the post. This will improve the user experience. ### Screenshot:

issueDTO.title: `DataFrame.cache()` does not work in distributed environments
comments:
> Hey. Can i take this one? Please assign

Feel free to take this issue by leaving a comment with just the word `take`

See reference in contributor guide: https://datafusion.apache.org/contributor-guide/index.html#open-contribution-and-assigning-tickets
take
@alamb if you have time it would be great to get your opinion about this issue as solving it may require some coding.

In terms of designing an API, I think it would help me to understand what behavior you want in Ballista  when a user runs `DataFrame::cache` (aka how wll you use this API)?

For example do you want it to write to fies distributed across the nodes?

It seems to me at the moment `DataFrame::cache` is basically a shorthand for 

```sql
"CREATE TABLE <temp> AS SELECT * FROM <dataframe>
```

The current implementation has a hard coded MemTable and the orchestration (creation of the MemTable / batches) is in the DataFrame::cache function itself.

If you want to move the logic to LogicalPlans you'll probably also have to add an equivalent physical node that handles the orchestration

Ballista will create cache partitions locally on some of the executors. Handling the physical part of execution is specific to the implementor, such as Ballista in this case.

Overall flow would be something like:

1. Ballista receives `LogicalPlan::Cache`
2. `LogicalPlan::Cache` is then converted to `BallistaCacheReadExec` , this part is handled with `BallistaQueryPlanner` (there is a bit more to it, a job can be started which would create cache with `BallistaCacheWriteExec` if not materialised already, task will be pending until cache job creation is in progress, cache partitions can be re-created in case of node failures ...)  

As the physical execution is tied to an external system (cache implementer) I believe we do not need to bring `CachePhysicalExec` to DataFusion, we just need to provide a `LogicalPlan::Cache`. 

With the proposed solution we would be able to keep the current behaviour, or we can delegate cache handling to the external system if we wish. So if the user disables local cache `datafusion.execution.local_cache=false` it would be up to them to provide a query planner which would know how to handle `LogicalPlan::Cache`

Probably it would make more sense to name `datafusion.execution.local_cache=false`, `datafusion.execution.external_cache=true`

>  I believe we do not need to bring CachePhysicalExec to DataFusion, we just need to provide a LogicalPlan::Cache.

That makes sense to me and the idea of being able to specially handle LogicalPlan nodes seems reasonable to me

I dug around and it seems like we already do this for various DDL here: 
https://github.com/apache/datafusion/blob/cb69574c0ff326ff975c58234b124904add33cfc/datafusion/core/src/execution/context/mod.rs#L664-L663

What if we instead changed `DataFrame::cache` to use a `LogicalPlan::DDL` / `CreateMemoryTable` https://github.com/apache/datafusion/blob/a571b7d44436c5c2bf641444857e8358edd9d8a8/datafusion/expr/src/logical_plan/ddl.rs#L41-L40 

Then ballista could use the same mechanism?

Create memory table may work, input property may be used as lineage, table reference can capture cache id and session I'd. 

One thing I need to check if DDL statements will be propagated to custom query planner, if I recall correctly they might be intercepted

looking at spark, cache is represented as `InMemoryRelation` : 

```python
from pyspark.sql import SparkSession
spark : SparkSession = SparkSession.builder.getOrCreate()
# %%
df0 = spark.read.parquet("./tpch-data-sf10/lineitem")
df1 = df0.filter("l_partkey == 1")
df2 = df1.cache()
df2.explain()
```

will produce:

```
== Optimized Logical Plan ==
InMemoryRelation [l_orderkey#0L, l_partkey#1L, l_suppkey#2L, l_linenumber#3, l_quantity#4, l_extendedprice#5, l_discount#6, l_tax#7, l_returnflag#8, l_linestatus#9, l_shipdate#10, l_commitdate#11, l_receiptdate#12, l_shipinstruct#13, l_shipmode#14, l_comment#15], StorageLevel(disk, memory, deserialized, 1 replicas)
   +- *(1) Filter (isnotnull(l_partkey#1L) AND (l_partkey#1L = 1))
      +- *(1) ColumnarToRow
         +- FileScan parquet [l_orderkey#0L,l_partkey#1L,l_suppkey#2L,l_linenumber#3,l_quantity#4,l_extendedprice#5,l_discount#6,l_tax#7,l_returnflag#8,l_linestatus#9,l_shipdate#10,l_commitdate#11,l_receiptdate#12,l_shipinstruct#13,l_shipmode#14,l_comment#15] Batched: true, DataFilters: [isnotnull(l_partkey#1L), (l_partkey#1L = 1)], Format: Parquet, Location: InMemoryFileIndex(1 paths)[file:/Users/marko/TMP/tpch-data-sf10/lineitem], PartitionFilters: [], PushedFilters: [IsNotNull(l_partkey), EqualTo(l_partkey,1)], ReadSchema: struct<l_orderkey:bigint,l_partkey:bigint,l_suppkey:bigint,l_linenumber:int,l_quantity:decimal(15...

```

Looks like create memory table will be handled by datafusion context 

https://github.com/apache/datafusion/blob/fd7df66724f958a2d44ba1fda1b11dc6833f0296/datafusion/core/src/execution/context/mod.rs#L662

https://github.com/apache/datafusion/blob/fd7df66724f958a2d44ba1fda1b11dc6833f0296/datafusion/core/src/execution/context/mod.rs#L807-L808

So it looks like create memory table will not be propagated to custom query planner.

> Looks like create memory table will be handled by datafusion context
> 
> [datafusion/datafusion/core/src/execution/context/mod.rs](https://github.com/apache/datafusion/blob/fd7df66724f958a2d44ba1fda1b11dc6833f0296/datafusion/core/src/execution/context/mod.rs#L662)
> 
> Line 662 in [fd7df66](/apache/datafusion/commit/fd7df66724f958a2d44ba1fda1b11dc6833f0296)

> [datafusion/datafusion/core/src/execution/context/mod.rs](https://github.com/apache/datafusion/blob/fd7df66724f958a2d44ba1fda1b11dc6833f0296/datafusion/core/src/execution/context/mod.rs#L807-L808)
> 
> Lines 807 to 808 in [fd7df66](/apache/datafusion/commit/fd7df66724f958a2d44ba1fda1b11dc6833f0296)
>

>      let CreateMemoryTable {

What we do in InfluxDB is basically override `sql` and specially handle all the DDL commands -- maybe ballista could do the same 🤔

> > [datafusion/datafusion/core/src/execution/context/mod.rs](https://github.com/apache/datafusion/blob/fd7df66724f958a2d44ba1fda1b11dc6833f0296/datafusion/core/src/execution/context/mod.rs#L807-L808)

> > let CreateMemoryTable {
> > So it looks like create memory table will not be propagated to custom query planner.
> 
> What we do in InfluxDB is basically override `sql` and specially handle all the DDL commands -- maybe ballista could do the same 🤔

I'm trying to keep Ballista???s `SessionContext` the same as DataFusion???s `SessionContext`. I believe there are a lot of benefits to sharing the same context.

if we use `LogicalPlan::TableScan( )` where we implement custom `InMemoryTableSource` (implementing `TableSource`)  may make sense. `TableSource` exposes `TableSource::get_logical_plan` which could capture lineage.  This would be quite aligned with spark, and would not introduce new logical plan node  🤔

issueDTO.title: Add Support for Ruby Mixins (Modules)
issueDTO.description:
*   **Description:** Ruby uses modules to group methods. When a class includes a module, it gains the module's methods.
*   **Graphing Strategy:** Model as an `INCLUDES` relationship from a `:Class` node to a `:Module` node.

### Implementation Steps

This requires a `:Module` node type and an `INCLUDES` relationship.

1.  **Modify the Ruby Parser (`.../languages/ruby.py`)**
    *   Add queries to find both `module` definitions and `include` statements within classes.
    *   Create `_find_modules` and `_find_module_inclusions` methods.
    *   Return the results under keys `"modules"` and `"module_inclusions"`.

2.  **Update the Generic Graph Builder (`.../tools/graph_builder.py`)**
    *   Add a `:Module` node type following the standard procedure (add constraint to `create_schema`, add to `item_mappings`).
    *   Add a new section in `add_file_to_graph` to process `module_inclusions` and create the `INCLUDES` relationships.

issueDTO.title: Replace `{{ NODE_RPC_URL }}` on `.cairo.template` files only
issueDTO.description:
### Which components does the task require to be changed? (think hard pls)

snforge

### Description

`replace_node_rpc_url_placeholders` is called whenever a test package (from `crates/forge/tests/data/`) is being set up for a test. It then processes all the files inside that set up package, no matter their extension. Because of that, it searches for `{{ NODE_RPC_URL }}` in all of the project files, making unnecessary overhead - it should only read from files that have `.cairo.template` extension.

1. Change function implementation to replace contents of only those files that have the `.cairo.template` extension.
2. Change extension of `.cairo` files in `/crates/forge/tests/data/` that contain `{{ NODE_RPC_URL }}` string to `.cairo.template`.

Original discussion [here](https://github.com/foundry-rs/starknet-foundry/pull/2004#discussion_r1570880935).

Search in code by `TODO (#2074)`
comments: Hey! I would like to work on this. Could you assign it to me?
@SourishBiswas23 feel free to submit a PR 👍
Was not resolved

issueDTO.title: Error when importing ```findPackageJSON``` method from ```node:module```
issueDTO.description:
### What version of Bun is running?

1.3.0+b0a6feca5

### What platform is your computer?

Linux 6.8.0-85-generic x86_64 x86_64

### What steps can reproduce the bug?

1. create a file ```test.mjs``` with the following content:
```ts
import { findPackageJSON } from 'node:module';

findPackageJSON(import.meta.resolve('lodash'));
```
2. run it like ```bun test.mjs```


### What is the expected behavior?

It should give no output, since the above does not throw a SyntaxError in Node.js.

### What do you see instead?

```
SyntaxError: Export named 'findPackageJSON' not found in module 'node:module'.
      at loadAndEvaluateModule (2:1)
```

### Additional information

The method ```findPackageJSON``` is not tied to any missing feature listed in bun documentation, in regards of ```node:module```.
comments: ENG-21117
I'm interested in working on this issue. Could you provide more context about what you're looking for? Any additional details about requirements or constraints would be helpful.

Hi @tysoncung thanks for the reply.

In Node.js the expected behaviour is to return the path to the package given as argument. In my example, after `npm install lodash`, the method `findPackageJSON` should return the path to `lodash`. 

In case the package is not present, then an `Error [ERR_MODULE_NOT_FOUND]: Cannot find package 'lodash'` is thrown.

issueDTO.title: Add support for Apache Spark credentials
issueDTO.description:
## Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.

I'm running into an issue when trying to manage Apache Spark credentials and environment-specific schemas through Terraform because the `dbtcloud_databricks_credential` resource doesn't support `adapter_type = "spark" (or apache_spark?)`.
Currently, when attempting to create Spark credentials:
```
resource "dbtcloud_databricks_credential" "apache_spark" {
  project_id   = dbtcloud_project.project.id
  token        = var.credentials.token
  schema       = var.credentials.schema
  adapter_type = "spark"
}
```
The provider fails with:

```
Error: Spark adapter not supported

Spark adapter is not supported currently for global connections credentials. 
Please raise a GitHub issue if you need it
```

This means Apache Spark deployment environments get credential_id = null and cannot have environment-specific schemas (staging/production) managed through Terraform, forcing manual configuration in the dbt Cloud UI.

## Describe the solution you'd like

The ability to set a token and a schema (on the deployment envs) to an apache spark project (any way possible)

## Additional context
Technical Context:
- Provider Version: dbt-labs/dbtcloud ~> 1.0
- Source Code: The validation appears to be in `pkg/framework/objects/databricks_credential/schema.go`
- Error Message: Explicitly suggests "Please raise a GitHub issue if you need it"

My Apache Spark Global Connection:
```
resource "dbtcloud_global_connection" "apache_spark_connection" {
  name = "My Apache Spark connection
  apache_spark = {
    method          = "http"
    host            = "my-spark-host.com"
    cluster         = "123-12345-example"
    connect_timeout = 100
  }
}
```
comments:
Hey Tim, thanks for raising this. Indeed, we don't support Apache creds yet, but we can add it to the roadmap.
Alternatively, if you're considering making a contribution, we're happy to assist. There are similar examples made for credentials added so it should be fairly straightforward.
This issue has been marked as Stale because it has been open for 90 days with no activity. If you would like the issue to remain open, please comment on the issue or else it will be closed in 7 days.

resource "dbtcloud_semantic_layer_configuration" "only_semantic_layer" {

  environment_id = dbtcloud_environment.prod_deployment_environment.environment_id
}

The semantic layer is configured in dbt cloud and I can create the access keys manually on the ui

issueDTO.title: Add bash language specification to code blocks in Sinhala translation
issueDTO.description:
🎯 **Goal**
Add missing language specification to code blocks in the Sinhala translation of the README to improve syntax highlighting and readability.

🐞 **Problem**
The Sinhala translation has code blocks without language specifications (just ``` instead of ```bash), which prevents proper syntax highlighting and makes the commands less readable.

💡 **What needs to be done**
Add `bash` language specification to all code blocks containing shell commands. You can find the file at:
https://github.com/firstcontributions/first-contributions/blob/main/docs/translations/README.si.md

**What needs to be changed:**
- Find all code blocks that contain shell commands (git commands, terminal commands)
- add bash language specification to these code blocks

**Example of what needs to be fixed:**

Currently without language specification
    \`\`\`
    git clone git@github.com:this-is-you/first-contributions.git
    \`\`\`

 Should be (with bash language specification)
    \`\`\`bash
    git clone git@github.com:this-is-you/first-contributions.git
    \`\`\`

> [!IMPORTANT]
> Please only address one issue in a PR.
> Let's make it possible for more people to solve issues here.

📋  **Steps to solve the problem**

*   Comment below about what you've started working on.
*   Find all code blocks in the Sinhala README that contain shell/git commands
*   Add `bash` language specification to these code blocks
*   Ensure syntax highlighting works properly
*   Add, commit, push your changes.
*   Submit a pull request and add this in comments - 'Resolves #<put issue number here>'
*   Ask for reviews in comments section of pull request.
*   Celebrate your contribution to this project. 🎉

issueDTO.title: Automatic import of logisim librarys instruction outdated
issueDTO.description:
Hello logisim dev team,

while being required to use an external logisim-evolution library for college I realised that I needed to import the library every time I opened logisim. While I found the documentation on how to import libraries automatically [here](https://github.com/logisim-evolution/logisim-evolution/blob/main/docs/automatic_library_import.md) I realised the instructions seem a little outdated. 

I managed to get it to work by creating the logisim-defaults directory in `C:\Program Files\logisim-evolution\app`, however I think it would make things easier to update the screenshot in the documentation so it doesn't show `C:\Program Files\logisim-evolution\build\libs` as the directory.

Maybe it's an option to add automatic library loading as a setting too?
comments: @peddyjet or @charles-fox: Could you please have a look at this issue, as you contributed this enhancement in PR #2226?

issueDTO.title: Unable to rename PK column named `id`
issueDTO.description:
## Steps to reproduce

1. Create a new table from scratch.
1. Use the table inspector to rename the `id` column to `pk`.
1. Expect the column to be renamed.
1. Observe that the column is not renamed and no error message is displayed.

This appears to be a backend bug somewhere below the `columns.patch` API. That API gives a success response in this case when in fact the column was not renamed.
comments:
Correction: This only affects columns which are both primary keys, _and_ named `id`. I've updated the issue title accordingly. For example, if one creates a table on the DB:

```sql
CREATE TABLE testable2 (
  mypk integer PRIMARY KEY GENERATED BY DEFAULT AS IDENTITY, 
  col1 text
);
```
You can change that primary key column to be named `pk`, or even `id`. But, if you change it to be named `id`, you can't change it anymore after that.

As with a bug in a recent PR (#4880), this goes back to the concept of a "default Mathesar ID column". See that issue for related discussion.

I still think it's probably worth taking a comprehensive look at whether we really need that concept anymore. 

As a short-term solution, we should just issue an error when a user attempts to `ALTER` a Mathesar default ID column. I think in the long term, they should be allowed to modify it as they wish, but that may have other effects.

repository.description: An intuitive spreadsheet-like interface that lets users of all technical skill levels view, edit, query, and collaborate on Postgres data directly???100% open source and self hosted, with native Postgres access control.
repository.name: mathesar

summary.main: Unable to rename PK column named `id` due to a backend bug in the `columns.patch` API.
summary.validationOrRequirement: Columns must not be both primary keys and named `id`.
summary.attemptedFixes: None mentioned
summary.otherNotes: The issue affects columns which are both primary keys and named `id`. It's related to the concept of a default Mathesar ID column. A short-term solution is to issue an error when a user attempts to `ALTER` a Mathesar default ID column.

issueDTO.title: `Edit Dialogs`: Disable Save for Nonsense Values
issueDTO.description:
### Describe the bug

When editing a course or a lecture I can input nonsense values for the different inputs - e.g. a random string for one of the dates - and the form lets me still save the edited course and sends me back to the detail view.

### To Reproduce

1. Go to editing a course with an account that is allowed to do that
2. Enter random characters into one of the date fields for instance
3. Click the save button
4. It saves and you're redirected to the detail view

### Expected behavior

As soon as I enter invalid inputs, the save button should be disabled and I should see an error of what is wrong.

Two possible ideas how to implement this: 
1. Create a wrapper component around the date picker that includes functionality to check if a date is valid or not
2. Create a wrapper object around dayjs which checks for valid dates.

For additional checks like startDate before endDate, it would also make sense to extract helper functions or create an Angular pipe which takes care of this.

### Screenshots

_No response_

### Which version of Artemis are you seeing the problem on?

6.0.2

### What browsers are you seeing the problem on?

Safari

### Additional context

_No response_
### Relevant log output

_No response_
comments: There hasn't been any activity on this issue recently. Therefore, this issue has been automatically marked as stale and will be closed if no further activity occurs within **180** days. Thank you for your contributions.

The reported issue has been resolved. The Date field now includes proper error handling and warning logic. When an invalid value is entered, the system rejects it and displays a warning message.
As shown in the related issues listed below, the functionality works as intended, and this task can be closed.
In Case #6378, a video was shared demonstrating that everything functions correctly.
In Case #8147, additional confirmation was provided that the warning message works as expected, and the case has been closed.
Related Issues:
General: Prevent invalid date values in edit dialogs ??? #6378 --> closed
Exam mode: Improve date time picker ??? #8147 --> merged

summary.otherNotes: The issue has been automatically marked as stale and will be closed if no further activity occurs within 180 days.

https://github.com/vllm-project/vllm/blob/main/vllm/model_executor/models/siglip.py
> """Implementation of SiglipVisionModel intended to be only used
within a vision language model."""

However, SigLip 2 can be very useful for zero-shot image classification and image-text retrieval

_No response_

### Before submitting a new issue...

What this issue is asking for is to support SigLIP2 as a standalone image embedding model, rather than a generative model that includes SigLIP2 as a component.
From my understanding, you need transformers v4.49 to use SigLIP2.

> From my understanding, you need transformers v4.49 to use SigLIP2.

Yes, I use this version `pip install git+https://github.com/huggingface/transformers@v4.49.0-SigLIP-2`.

Hi @DarkLight1337 , I would love to look into implementing `VllmModelForPooling` and `SupportsMultiModal` interface so that Siglip can be used for zero-shot image classification. 

I started by looking at HF Siglip implementation and Multi-Modal support [documentation](https://docs.vllm.ai/en/latest/contributing/model/multimodal.html#). In the HF SiglipModel [forward](https://github.com/huggingface/transformers/blob/main/src/transformers/models/siglip/modeling_siglip.py#L1412) function, it calculates the cosine similarity between text_embdes and image_embdes, rather than inserting the image_embeds into input embeddings. 

So I guess we don't need `image_token_index`, right? What about the other steps in [Multi-Modal support](https://docs.vllm.ai/en/latest/contributing/model/multimodal.html#)? I am wondering which ones are needed for autoregressive models and can be removed in SiglipModel.

`SiglipModel` is not really a classification model, rather it is an embedding model. The vLLM implementation of the model should only output the embeddings. The calculation of cosine similarity is better left to the vector database if you're planning on doing retrieval/RAG. On a smaller scale, you can use `LLM.score` (or `/score` endpoint for online serving) to get the similarity scores within a single request, once the model has been implemented as an embedding model in vLLM.
Hey, would like to take a pass at this if others aren't working on it 🙂 @lengrongfu @jiaxinzhang18 are either of you still planning to contribute it?
@alex-jw-brooks you can contribute it.

This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has not had any activity within 90 days. It will be automatically closed if no further activity occurs within 30 days. Leave a comment if you feel this issue should remain open. Thank you!

> Seems like there???ve been quite a few attempts before me, but I'm on it now :)

@duc-ph on this? or shall we join forces ?!
Hmm. Is it same as `siglip2navit`? https://github.com/vllm-project/vllm/blob/main/vllm/model_executor/models/siglip2navit.py

As mentioned in https://github.com/vllm-project/vllm/issues/13663#issuecomment-2674184406, the original SigLIP2 should have the same architecture as the one in `siglip.py`, but additional code is needed to be able to use it in an E2E fashion.
The scope of this issue is to be able to run this model E2E in vLLM as an embedding model

Got it. I'm up for it as I see no one working on it! 

Please assign @DarkLight1337

Hey @rozeappletree, I am sure things have changed a bit, but I did have a branch for this that was at one point working for image embeddings - I've pushed it [here](https://github.com/alex-jw-brooks/vllm/tree/siglip_image_embed). Feel free to use it as a starting point if you'd like to 🙂 

There was one point of awkwardness that I remember running into on this branch, which was that models like siglip/clip etc are only used in vLLM for their visual encoders, and don't implement the text encoder, while the standalone models like https://huggingface.co/google/siglip2-base-patch16-224 also come with the text encoder. This was weird (at least at the time) to consider because it meant either

- loading the model means only loading the image encoder & ignoring text for encoding, which is what the branch on my fork was intending to do

or
 
- potentially adding the text encoder, and figuring out how that should be handled wrt the embeddings API since the embeddings from the vision/text encoders are usually not merged (i.e., usually used for similarity, so there is no image token)

I'm sure @DarkLight1337 has good thoughts on that, which may be helpful since you'll probably run into something similar. Sorry for losing track of this issue, and thank you for picking it up!
Hi @alex-jw-brooks thanks for the inputs! Incredibly helpful 💯

Thanks @alex-jw-brooks for the update!

We should implement both the text and vision encoder in vLLM. To avoid having to load different vLLM instances for each part, we should be able to handle both types of inputs in a single model class. This can be achieved by having a pooling model that wraps both encoders.
Do we have a specific reason why siglip doesn't come with a text encoder?
We only previously implemented SigLIP as part of MLLMs, which only includes the vision encoder
Any progress on this great embedding model? 🍀
@learning4life lets collab??
You can refer to https://github.com/vllm-project/vllm/pull/26010 which implements CLIP

Hi all @rozeappletree @DarkLight1337 ,
Is there any progress on integrating this model? 

If not, I can create a PR for this soon
@apoorv-stackav please take it up!
@DarkLight1337 I have support siglip(v1) embedding https://github.com/vllm-project/vllm/pull/27324, passed all tests, please review it.

However, I found that supporting SigLIP 2 will require some additional work. While SigLIP 2 shares a similar architecture with SigLIP, there are notable differences in the implementation of certain layers. For example:

- SigLIP uses a different vision embedding implementation: [SiglipVisionEmbeddings](https://github.com/huggingface/transformers/blob/v4.57.1/src/transformers/models/siglip/modeling_siglip.py#L224)
- SigLIP 2 has its own implementation: [Siglip2VisionEmbeddings](https://github.com/huggingface/transformers/blob/a8cece13e29057fc9712543402d73e78796b306d/src/transformers/models/siglip2/modeling_siglip2.py#L124)

These architectural differences mean that we cannot simply reuse the same model file. Following the pattern of [Siglip embedding support](https://github.com/vllm-project/vllm/pull/27324), I think creating a separate `siglip2.py` file would be a better approach for proper SigLIP 2 support, rather than trying to handle both models in a single file.

I will continue to support siglip2 embedding.

repository.description: A high-throughput and memory-efficient inference and serving engine for LLMs
repository.name: vllm

summary.main: Support SigLIP2 as a standalone image embedding model, rather than a generative model that includes SigLIP2 as a component.
summary.validationOrRequirement: transformers v4.49, VllmModelForPooling, SupportsMultiModal interface
summary.attemptedFixes: The model has the same architecture as SigLIP v1. We just need to modify the code a bit so that it can be directly called in vLLM from the model worker (i.e. implementing the VllmModelForPooling and SupportsMultiModal interface).
summary.otherNotes: The model to consider. The closest model vllm already supports. Implementation of SiglipVisionModel intended to be only used within a vision language model. SigLIP 2 can be very useful for zero-shot image classification and image-text retrieval. The issue is asking for support SigLIP2 as a standalone image embedding model, rather than a generative model that includes SigLIP2 as a component. From my understanding, you need transformers v4.49 to use SigLIP2.

issueDTO.title: Ctrl+(P/N) does not work correctly with "Search project files" in Helix mode
issueDTO.description:
### Summary

<!-- Begin your issue with a one sentence summary -->
Helix mode currently does not navigate the file selection properly when searching through the project files via the prompt.

### Description
<!--  Describe with sufficient detail to reproduce from a clean Zed install.
  - Any code must be sufficient to reproduce (include context!)
  - Include code as text, not just as a screenshot.
  - Issues with insufficient detail may be summarily closed.
-->

Pressing Ctrl+(P/N) always moves forward the selection to the next file. Moreover, letting go after Ctrl+P opens the file while Ctrl+N doesn't. Other prompts like "Search project symbols" work correctly.

Steps to reproduce:
1. Enable Helix mode
2. Ctrl+P to open the prompt
3. Type in anything to get more than one file as the results.

**Expected Behavior**: Ctrl+P goes up to previous selection and doesn't open the file automatically after letting it go.
**Actual Behavior**: Described above.

<!-- Before Submitting, did you:
  1. Include settings.json, keymap.json, .editorconfig if relevant?
  2. Check your Zed.log for relevant errors? (please include!)
  3. Click Preview to ensure everything looks right?
  4. Hide videos, large images and logs in ``` inside collapsible blocks:

<details><summary>click to expand</summary>

```json

```
</details>
-->


### Zed Version and System Specs

Zed: v0.208.5 (Zed) 
OS: Windows 10.0.26200
Memory: 15.3 GiB
Architecture: x86_64
GPU: AMD Radeon(TM) Graphics || AMD Corporation || 25.9.1 (25.10.25.10-250825a-418637C-AMD-Software-Adrenalin-Edition)
comments: Thanks for the report! That does seem like an inconsistency we should fix (which should hopefully not be too hard, hence the `good first issue`)

One note that this inconsistency is needed in some form to mimic what VSCode does ("fluent" file picker): https://github.com/zed-industries/zed/pull/39558#issuecomment-3369270821

But sure this is not needed for non-VSCode base keymaps and modes.
@MrSubidubi can i work on this
@virajbhartiya Feel free to! We generally do not assign issues, but we'll definitely look at any PR for this that you'll open!

issueDTO.title: Refactor examples/topic_create to be modular
issueDTO.description:
## 🆕🐥 First Timers Only

This issue is reserved for people who have never or only very recently contributed to [Hiero](https://hiero.org) or any open source project in general.
We know that creating a pull request (PR) is a major barrier for new contributors.
The goal of this issue and all other issues labeled by [**'good first issue'**](https://github.com/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+org%3Ahiero-ledger+archived%3Afalse+label%3A%22good+first+issue%22+) is to help you make your first contribution to Hiero.

## 👾 Description of the issue

The current topic_create.py script demonstrates creating a new topic. However, all the logic is inside a single function which makes it harder to read, maintain, and reuse. 

## 💡 Solution
Refactoring the script into modular functions will make it easier for contributors and beginners to understand the workflow.

Acceptance Criteria:

- [ ] Running python examples/topic_create.py produces the same output as before.
- [ ] All functionality is preserved.
- [ ] Code is modular, readable, and reusable for other scripts or examples.

### 👩???💻 Implementation
- [ ]  Create a function setup_client()
- [ ]  Create a function create_topic
- [ ]  Refactor the main workflow to use the above functions instead of having all logic in a single function.

### 👩???💻 Requirements to Pass
- [ ] As above
- [ ] Changelog check
- [ ] Verified commits achieved (see CONTRIBUTING.md)


If you have never contributed to an open source project at GitHub, the following step-by-step guide will introduce you to the workflow.
More information and concrete samples for shell commands for each step can be found in our [CONTRIBUTING.md](https://github.com/hiero-ledger/.github/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md) file.
A more detailed general documentation of the GitHub PR workflow can be found [here](https://github.com/firstcontributions/first-contributions/blob/master/README.md).

For more more detailed python specific contributing guides, please see:
[CONTRIBUTING.md](https://github.com/hiero-ledger/hiero-sdk-python/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md) file.
and [README.md](https://github.com/hiero-ledger/hiero-sdk-python/blob/main/README.md).

- [ ] **Claim this issue:** Comment below that you are interested in working on the issue
- [ ] **Wait for assignment:** A community member with the given rights will add you as an assignee of the issue
- [ ] **Work on the issue:** Follow the detailed description in our [CONTRIBUTING.md](https://github.com/hiero-ledger/hiero-sdk-python/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md) file.

issueDTO.title: PEP-484 Type Hints
issueDTO.description:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**

We use python with strict typing at our organization which means we have to add a bunch of "type: ignore" comments wherever this library is used. Adding types would make working with this library much easier and require much less context switching between the docs and the editor thanks to autocomplete.

**Describe the solution you'd like**

I understand a bunch of functionality in this library is very hard to type (dynamic clients, etc.), so maybe this effort could start with the JOSE module.

**Describe alternatives you've considered**

Alternatively, type stubs for this library could be added to the [typeshed](https://github.com/python/typeshed) project but that is not ideal as it would be very easy for those to get out of sync.
comments: Is there any interest in this from maintainers? Would a PR be welcome, or is there some discussion that should take place prior to that?
We are in the same situation in my organization as @relsunkaev. Is there any movement in this direction?
I just noticed this issue has been labeled which I'm gonna take as an endorsement and take a stab at a PR.
@relsunkaev If you haven't got time to work on this, I can make a draft PR regarding this issue. If you've already made some progress, I'd be happy to help

> @relsunkaev If you haven't got time to work on this, I can make a draft PR regarding this issue. If you've already made some progress, I'd be happy to help

I have indeed made some progress, I will share the repository soon.
I've created a separated `jose` module with type hints: https://github.com/authlib/joserfc

> I've created a separated `jose` module with type hints: https://github.com/authlib/joserfc

Thanks for making this happen, we have done very smooth transition.
Just pledged $50 to this issue on Polar, I'd love to see this get implemented
If authlib added a `py.typed` marker already, it would let mypy see through e.g. `authlib.integrations.httpx_client.OAuth2Client` and use httpx's typing support when calling `.get(...)` etc.

issueDTO.title: [Merlin] Curious Unbound module issue
issueDTO.description:
I am running into quite a perplexing issue:

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/04896779-1c65-438e-bc2f-d58bbe98243f

In essence, if I have a library `lib` and try to utilize it in an executable where there are multiple executables in the same folder and dune file, then the naming of the file will matter and the one utilizing the library will need to be first alphabetically?

I guess notably compilation with `dune` succeeds each time, but it seems the lsp is requiring something more?

Small example shown in screen recording: [Durbatuluk1701/module_bug](https://github.com/Durbatuluk1701/module_bug)
comments: Thanks for your report @Durbatuluk1701. I suspect that the issue lies in Dune's configuration server `dune ocaml merlin` which is not serving the correct configuration to ocaml-lsp. To make sure of that one should write a test shwoing the output of the server in these cases (here is an [example](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/blob/main/test/blackbox-tests/test-cases/merlin/server.t/run.t))

Your intuition seems to be valid. Attached is a diff between the working version (left) when target file is `a.ml` and failing version (right) when target file is `c.ml`. Generated via: ```bash TESTFILE=./bin/(a | c).ml printf "(4:File%d:%s)" ${#TESTFILE} $TESTFILE | dune ocaml-merlin ```

Right, when you query the configuration for `c.ml` you definitely want it to contain the `.c.eobjs` folder, not the `.b.eobjs`, it seems you do get the first one in alphabetical order. Let's move it to Dune then.

summary.otherNotes: The issue is related to Dune's configuration server and ocaml-lsp, with a possible solution involving a test to show the output of the server in certain cases.

issueDTO.title: Implement AUC-ROC in Kaun metrics
issueDTO.description:
## Why it matters
The monitoring dashboard needs reliable curve metrics. `Kaun.Metrics.auc_roc` is currently a placeholder that always raises. Without a real implementation you cannot plot ROC curves or compare models.

## How to see the gap
Open `kaun/lib/kaun/metrics.ml` around the `auc_roc` definition. The `compute` function simply calls `failwith`. The unit tests in `kaun/test/test_metrics.ml` also skip any AUC checks.

## Your task
- Implement trapezoidal integration for the AUC-ROC metric. Accept the existing `num_thresholds` and `curve` arguments so callers can request either the scalar area or the raw curve points.
- Store intermediate true-positive and false-positive counts in the metric state so updates can be streamed batch by batch.
- Add tests in `kaun/test/test_metrics.ml` that feed known score/label pairs and compare the result against pre-computed values (you can compute the numbers in Python once and paste them as constants).

## Tips
- Start by sorting predictions and accumulating TP/FP counts; the integration step is a simple sum of trapezoids.
- Keep numerical stability in mind???add a tiny epsilon where you divide to avoid `NaN` in edge cases.
- If `curve = true`, return both the AUC scalar and the list of `(fpr, tpr)` points so future visualisations can use them.

## Done when
- `auc_roc` returns a scalar area for the default path and optional curve data when requested.
- The new tests pass and cover both balanced and imbalanced label sets.
- `dune runtest kaun` succeeds after your changes.

issueDTO.title: [Bug]: Unnecessary Email Sent on Each User Invite
issueDTO.description: ### Description Currently, whenever a company invites a new user to their team, an automated email (subject: **???Requesting more users???**) is sent to the company???s own email address. This behavior is redundant the company should **not** receive an email every time they invite someone. ### Expected Behavior - No email should be sent to the company when they invite new users. - Only the invited users (if applicable) should receive an email. ### Current Behavior - Every time a new user is invited, the system sends a confirmation email to the company (e.g., ???We are so glad you want to share Weam with everyone on your team...???). - This clutters the company inbox with unnecessary messages. ### Steps to Reproduce 1. Log in as a company admin. 2. Invite a new user to the organization. 3. issueDTO.title: Move environment variable parsing to `EnvironmentOptions`
issueDTO.description:
In https://github.com/astral-sh/uv/pull/14662 I added a new `EnvironmentOptions` abstraction which allows us to express semantics that Clap cannot and perform up-front parsing of non-CLI environment variables, e.g., https://github.com/astral-sh/uv/pull/14544 and https://github.com/astral-sh/uv/pull/14369.

We should move other extraneous environment variables to be parsed there and provided through our usual settings structs.

These changes should be relatively easy. We should probably do it one variable at a time. 

- [ ] `UV_HTTP_RETRIES`
- [ ] `UV_COMPILE_BYTECODE_TIMEOUT`
- [ ] `UV_HTTP_TIMEOUT`
- [ ] `UV_REQUEST_TIMEOUT`
- [ ] `HTTP_TIMEOUT`
- [ ] `UV_RUN_RECURSION_DEPTH`
- [ ] `UV_CONCURRENT_DOWNLOADS`
- [ ] `UV_CONCURRENT_BUILDS`
- [ ] `UV_CONCURRENT_INSTALLS`
- [x] `UV_PYTHON_INSTALL_MIRROR`
- [x] `UV_PYPY_INSTALL_MIRROR`
- [x] `UV_PYTHON_DOWNLOADS_JSON_URL`
- [ ] `UV_NO_GITHUB_FAST_PATH`
- [ ] `UV_GITHUB_FAST_PATH_URL`
- [ ] `UV_GIT_LFS`
- [ ] `UV_CUDA_DRIVER_VERSION`
- [ ] `UV_AMD_GPU_ARCHITECTURE`
- [ ] `UV_STACK_SIZE`
- [ ] `UV_LOG_CONTEXT`
- [ ] `TRACING_DURATIONS_FILE`
- [ ] `UV_LOCK_TIMEOUT` (https://github.com/astral-sh/uv/pull/16342#discussion_r2448547512)
comments: For people that want to help out, it'd be good to search for other variables I should add to the todo list.
I pulled a bunch with AI, feel free to say that we shouldn't apply it for a given variable if it doesn't make sense.

Hi @zanieb may I take this one?

Just started learning rust (motivated by astrals work in the python field), but this looks like a good issue to start getting more into it.
I might need some guidance on the way though :)

Since the boolean parsing is already defined, adding the boolean env vars to `EnvironmentOptions` should be relative straightforward or?
What do you mean exactly by `one variable at a time`?

Best regards

Hey @Zaloog, yeah these should be fairly straight-forward. By "one at a time" I mean start with just (for example) `UV_HTTP_RETRIES` and make sure we're aligned on the pattern instead of moving _all_ of these variables at once.
like that @zanieb?
You'll then need to propagate it to where it's used.

the `UV_NO_GITHUB_FAST_PATH` env var is used in the `uv-git` crate [here](https://github.com/astral-sh/uv/blob/fa24d9a5e20434ea8c142f36d13942a9645b5cdf/crates/uv-git/src/resolver.rs#L76), 

Id think that I have to add `uv-settings` as workspace dependency to `uv-git` to propagate the EnvironmentsOptions,
I tried to do that, it fails though due to a circular import.
 
Or is there a different approach im not aware of?
Can't you propagate the setting without passing the entire settings struct?

You may have picked a hard setting to start with, because the `GitResolver` doesn't currently store state so you'll either need to make it hold settings or propagate the setting via invocations to the fast path by exposing it on the `BuildContext`. I'm not sure which is cleaner without digging deeper! We do stash some settings on `GitSource` so maybe that's the place to do so?

I started with the `UV_LOG_CONTEXT`, the other two booleans might be more effort like you mentioned above.

Is the approach on propagating it correct in that case?

For the `int`-like environment variables, id take a look on how the parsing is done on some current implementation and then
implement a function similar to `parse_boolish_environment_variable` but for integers.

For the string value ones, I think we could break those down further e.g. in environment variables which expect a pathlike string.

But id focus on the `int` ones first if thats ok
I currently do not have much time to continue working on this one. So if anyone else want to take over, feel free

Hi
I want to start with this issue and I think I will start with `UV_REQUEST_TIMEOUT` env variable
Feel free!

I created the PR #15937

This PR is not small because I need to pass `environment` to a lot of places
Next PR will be smaller

Can anyone take a look?
I've opened PR #16031. Could someone take a look?
One more PR #16040. This one is for parsing http-timeout
One more PR https://github.com/astral-sh/uv/pull/16223. This one is for parsing concurrency env variables

One more PR https://github.com/astral-sh/uv/pull/16284
But some CI checks failed because of timeout or missing API key
can anyone help me with this?

I do not know how to fix this
I just added import `reqwest-retry` and right now `Cargo.toml` is not changed
And right now all tests have passed

Can anyone take a look?

issueDTO.title: [Bug]: WDS Context Child Nodes Hidden Behind Parent Node
issueDTO.description:
### Is there an existing issue for this?

- [x] I have searched the existing issues and couldn't find a duplicate.

### Current Behavior

When clicking on collapse, all child nodes of the parent node in the WDS context tree view get hidden behind the parent node, making them inaccessible or invisible to the user.
users have to drag to see the context

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/8b8e0006-57ad-4f8a-a8ba-e4a2d3f51ecc

### Expected Behavior

Child nodes should remain visible and accessible when performing any close/collapse operations. The tree structure should maintain proper visibility and hierarchy.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Navigate to the WDS (Workload Description Service) page
2. Expand a parent node that has child nodes in the tree view
3. Click on collapse
4. Observe that child nodes become hidden behind the parent node
5. Child nodes are no longer accessible or visible

### Additional Context/Logs

```shell

```

issueDTO.title: [EPIC]??Missing doc metrics on 100+ tasks / plugins
issueDTO.description:
### Feature description

Some classes put metrics in the run context with `runContext.metric(...)` but don't have them properly documented with a `@Metric` sub-annotation in `metrics` attribute for `@Plugin` annotation. [See an example here](https://github.com/kestra-io/plugin-ai/pull/194/files).

The goal here is to add this annotation and also if needed check the metric fits the appropriate format for instance `fetch.size` instead of `fetchItemsCount` (lowerCamelCase).

We need a PR by plugin here.

summary.main: The main goal of this issue is to add `@Metric` annotations to classes in various plugins, to improve the documentation and maintainability of the code.
summary.validationOrRequirement: The requirement is to add `@Metric` annotations to classes in various plugins, and to ensure that the annotations are correct and follow best practices.
summary.attemptedFixes: Some contributors have already started working on this issue, and have created sub-issues for specific plugins. The comments section has been used to discuss the issue and assign tasks to contributors.
summary.otherNotes: The goal of this issue is to add `@Metric` annotations to some classes in various plugins, including AWS, Azure, GCP, and others. Some plugins have already been assigned, and contributors have started working on them. The issue has been discussed in the comments, and contributors have asked questions and confirmed their work.

issueDTO.title: Update tooltips to allow icon to be included.
issueDTO.description:
## Summary
Tooltips currently only have capacity to display a text label. This should be updated to allow the inclusion of a left aligned icon as well. 

## 💬 Description
When implementing a tooltip, an optional icon can be specified, and any icon can be chosen to display. It must always match the text colour, and it must be able to have customizable alt-text so that SRs can read it out. 

Alternatively, if the icon doesn't add any additional meaning to the tooltip label, then it can be excluded from SR announcements. For example, a tooltip showing the label 'Coffee' with an icon of a coffee cup doesn't need to read out both alt-text and label as this would be repetition. The icon is effectively labelled by the tooltip label. 

## 💰 Use value
This provides additional flexibility on the tooltip component to cater for more use cases. 

## Acceptance Criteria
Given that a tooltip is being implemented, 
When setting the properties
Then an option to display an icon exists, but it default turned off. 

Given that a tooltip is being implemented, and the icon has been selected to display,
When setting the properties
Then an option to use different icons from the default icon set is possible. 

Given that a tooltip is displayed with text and an icon, 
When the text wraps onto multiple lines, 
Then the text should become left aligned with the icon aligned vertically with the 1st line of text. 

![image](https://github.com/mi6/ic-ui-kit/assets/116820773/a694f927-e6b4-4d37-a911-237ec25f5959)

Given that a tooltip is being implemented with an icon,
When setting its properties, 
Then a property exists allowing the icon alt-text to be customized. 

Given that a tooltip is being implemented with an icon,
When setting its properties, 
Then a property exists allowing the icon alt-text to be excluded from the SR announcement. 



## Additional info
Tell us anything else useful to help us understand your suggestion.

See Figma branch '[Update] 223 - Tooltip dark variant' for designs.

issueDTO.title: [RW2] Type and unit labels not applied when using Prometheus Agent
issueDTO.description:
Hi! Thanks a lot to the Prometheus team for adding the new `type-and-unit-labels` feature!  

## Related PR
While testing it, i noticed some differences in behavior depending on the Prometheus mode.  

This behavior was tested after applying the changes from [#17329](https://github.com/prometheus/prometheus/pull/17329).  
While the improvement works correctly in standard Prometheus mode, the following results were observed when using the `agent` mode (details below).

---

##  Observed behavior

### Case 1 - Prometheus scrapes targets directly
Everything works as expected - the `__type__` label appears in the resulting metrics.

**Prometheus config**
```yaml
global:
  scrape_interval: 15s
  scrape_timeout: 10s
  evaluation_interval: 15s

scrape_configs:
  - job_name: 'node-exporter'
    static_configs:
      - targets: ['test-node-exporter:9100']
    relabel_configs:
      - source_labels: [__address__]
        regex: '(.*):(.*)'
        target_label: instance
        replacement: '${1}'
      - source_labels: [__address__]
        regex: '(.*):(.*)'
        target_label: port
        replacement: '${2}'
```

**Prometheus startup flags**
```shell
--enable-feature=type-and-unit-labels,metadata-wal-records
--web.enable-remote-write-receiver
--web.remote-write-receiver.accepted-protobuf-messages=io.prometheus.write.v2.Request
```

**Result**
```shell
[root@exp-01 grizzlybite]# curl -s 'http://192.168.100.7:9090/api/v1/query?query=node_memory_MemAvailable_bytes'  | jq '.data.result[0].metric'

{
  "__name__": "node_memory_MemAvailable_bytes",
  "__type__": "gauge",
  "instance": "test-node-exporter",
  "job": "node-exporter",
  "port": "9100"
}
```

---

### Case 2 - Prometheus Agent sends data via Remote Write v2
When Prometheus runs in **`--agent` mode** and sends metrics through **`remote_write`** using protobuf v2,  
the resulting metrics **do not contain** the `__type__` label - even with the same feature flags enabled.

**Prometheus (receiver)**
```shell
--enable-feature=type-and-unit-labels,metadata-wal-records
--web.enable-remote-write-receiver
--web.remote-write-receiver.accepted-protobuf-messages=io.prometheus.write.v2.Request
```

**Prometheus Agent**
```yaml
remote_write:
  - url: "http://127.0.0.1:9090/api/v1/write"
    protobuf_message: io.prometheus.write.v2.Request
    queue_config:
      max_shards: 40
      capacity: 10000
```

**Agent startup flags**
```shell
--agent
--enable-feature=type-and-unit-labels,metadata-wal-records
```

**Result**
```shell
[root@exp-01 grizzlybite]# curl -s 'http://192.168.100.7:9090/api/v1/query?query=node_memory_MemAvailable_bytes'  | jq '.data.result[0].metric'
{
  "__name__": "node_memory_MemAvailable_bytes",
  "instance": "test-node-exporter",
  "job": "node-exporter",
  "port": "9100"
}
```

---

##  Summary
It looks like the `__type__` label is currently **not propagated** when metrics are sent via Prometheus Agent -> Prometheus using Remote Write v2, even though both sides have  
`--enable-feature=type-and-unit-labels` enabled.

If this is the expected behavior (e.g., by design for the agent), please clarify.  
Otherwise, I???d be happy to help test any future fixes or patches!

---

**Environment**
- Prometheus 3.7.1
- node-exporter 1.9.1  
- Tested on AlmaLinux 9.6 (Sage Margay)
comments:
Thanks for reporting!

Yes, it's a generally known gap, we didn't test or check agent mode yet for RW2 in general -- we have @pipiland2612 planning to take a look on some of this work: https://github.com/prometheus/prometheus/issues/16945

Help wanted too! Let's leave it open until this works.

repository.description: The Prometheus monitoring system and time series database.
repository.name: prometheus

summary.main: The main goal of this issue is to investigate and resolve the issue where Type and unit labels are not applied when using Prometheus Agent, and to clarify whether this is the expected behavior.
summary.validationOrRequirement: The feature flag `--enable-feature=type-and-unit-labels` is required to be enabled on both Prometheus and Prometheus Agent, and Remote Write v2 is used.
summary.attemptedFixes: None mentioned in the issue, but the author is open to helping test any future fixes or patches.
summary.otherNotes: This issue is about Type and unit labels not being applied when using Prometheus Agent, with a known gap in testing for agent mode with Remote Write v2. The author is looking for help and clarification on whether this is the expected behavior.

comments: 10.0.6 is outdated, consider upgrading.

Bad experience with 10.0.7 and 10.0.8 so i keep the one whitch works with document added on timeline tickets.
Other glpi user has the same problem with 10.0.8

We won't investigate on an issue that may be fixed. Feel free to reopen if you reproduce with latest version.

Community support is on a best effort basis, debuging 3 versions late is not possible.

The only way I am able to reproduce this behaviour is when I voluntarly remove the `config/glpicrypt.key` file from my filesystem. I get the following error in GLPI logs:

```
glpiphplog.WARNING:   *** PHP User Warning (512): You must create a security key, see security:change_key command. in /var/www/glpi/src/GLPIKey.php at line 129
  Backtrace :
  src/GLPIKey.php:129                                trigger_error()
  src/GLPIKey.php:367                                GLPIKey->get()
  src/Config.php:2998                                GLPIKey->encrypt()
  src/Config.php:298                                 Config::setConfigurationValues()
  src/CommonDBTM.php:1589                            Config->prepareInputForUpdate()
  front/config.form.php:65                           CommonDBTM->update()
  public/index.php:82                                require()
```

Anyway, this is not supposed to be a normal behaviour. If file is missing or cannot be created during install/migration, an error is shown to user and tells him to run the `bin/console security:change_key` command to generate it manually.

Do you have a `config/glpicrypt.key` file?

[2023-07-12 15:04:17] glpiphplog.WARNING:   *** PHP User Warning (512): You must create a security key, see security:change_key command. in /opt/glpi/src/GLPIKey.php at line 125

  src/Config.php:299                                 Config::setConfigurationValues()
  src/CommonDBTM.php:1595                            Config->prepareInputForUpdate()
  front/config.form.php:65                           CommonDBTM->update()

or in local_define config dir is /newdir/glpi/.
i move .key file to /newdir/glpi/ and now registration works.

thanks @cedric-anne  to put me on right way to resolve this.
There is probably something that can be enhanced here. For instance, something should probably be shown on UI, even before trying to save the form.
yes, just an error displayed with a popup information should help to fix the problem quickly without asking here.

issueDTO.title: Revamp the Dashboard UI
issueDTO.description: The current dashboard UI needs a visual and functional revamp. Contributors are free to redesign and enhance the layout using modern UI libraries or custom React components. You can use any UI library of your choice such as: - **Aceternity UI** - **Magic UI** - **Shadcn/UI** - **Framer Motion** - **Tailwind Variants** - or any other compatible library that improves usability and aesthetics. --- ### What to Do - Redesign the **dashboard layout** to make it more engaging and intuitive. - Add or update **React components** for better modularity and reusability. - Integrate smooth transitions, icons, and responsive design principles. - Update the **Hero section** to include the **dashboard image** displayed inside a **container scroll component** (for visual preview). --- ### Deliverables - Revamped Dashboard UI (fully functional and responsive) - Updated Hero section with scroll-based dashboard preview - Clean, reusable component structure --- ### Tech Stack - Next.js + TypeScript - Tailwind CSS - Optional: Aceternity UI, Magic UI, or any additional library for design enhancement --- ### Acceptance Criteria - Dashboard UI follows a consistent theme with the rest of the app - The Hero section visually includes the dashboard image with a scroll animation - Code is modular, clean, and reviewed - PR includes **Before and After** screenshots of the dashboard --- ### Notes Be creative with the layout aim for a minimal, professional, and smooth design. Multiple contributors can collaborate on this issue if desired.

issueDTO.title: Use f-string and `{var_name=}` instead of `.format` and `var_name={var_name}`
issueDTO.description:
### Motivation

Now that Optuna does not support Python 3.8 anymore, we can use the `{var_name}=` syntax.
Since it is cleaner, I recommend using it instead of the good old style.

> [!IMPORTANT]
> To promote more contributions from a wide range of developers, please address only one file per PR:)

### Suggestion

Please fix one of the files below:
- https://github.com/search?q=repo%3Aoptuna%2Foptuna+%22.format&type=code&p=2

Example:

```python
## Current
message = "The `value` argument is of type '{}' but supposed to be a float.".format(
    type(value).__name__
)

## Preferred
message = f"The `value` argument is of type '{type(value).__name__}' but supposed to be a float."

## Current
if reduction_factor < 2:
    raise ValueError("`reduction_factor >= 2` must hold but got reduction_factor={}.".format(reduction_factor))

## Preferred
if reduction_factor < 2:
    raise ValueError(f"`reduction_factor >= 2` must hold but got {reduction_factor=}.")
```

### Additional context (optional)

_No response_
comments:
More Concrete Examples: 
- https://github.com/optuna/optuna/pull/6306
- https://github.com/optuna/optuna/pull/6307

Hi! Thank you for merging my previous PR. Since I???ve already contributed one file as requested, I just wanted to mention that if no one else contributes the remaining files and the issue deadline is approaching, I???d be happy to help by working on the other files as well. Please let me know if that would be helpful.

Thank you!

Hey there! Would it be fine if I contribute to this issue instead of unKnownNG? I'm new to this repo, so, it will be a good place for me to start contributing here😊

Cheers!
Hey! I'm new here, I don't know if i should get a permission to contribute to this issue but I will work on this issue, it sounds fun 😋

issueDTO.title: We should replace cantera.Species.fromCti() calls with cantera.Species.from_yaml() calls
issueDTO.description:
### Bug Description
The unit tests include the warning:
```
test/rmgpy/speciesTest.py::TestSpecies::test_cantera
  /home/runner/work/RMG-Py/RMG-Py/test/rmgpy/speciesTest.py:477: DeprecationWarning: XML_Node::build: 
  The CTI and XML input file formats are deprecated and will be removed in
  Cantera 3.0. Use 'cti2yaml.py' or 'ctml2yaml.py' to convert CTI or XML input
  files to the YAML format. See https://cantera.org/tutorials/legacy2yaml.html
  for more information.
```

The relevant part of  `RMG-Py/test/rmgpy/speciesTest.py` is 
```python
        rmg_ct_species = rmg_species.to_cantera(use_chemkin_identifier=True)

        ct_species = ct.Species.fromCti(
            """species(name=u'Ar',
        atoms='Ar:1',
        thermo=(NASA([200.00, 1000.00],
                     [ 2.50000000E+00,  0.00000000E+00,  0.00000000E+00,
                       0.00000000E+00,  0.00000000E+00, -7.45375000E+02,
                       4.37967000E+00]),
                NASA([1000.00, 6000.00],
                     [ 2.50000000E+00,  0.00000000E+00,  0.00000000E+00,
                       0.00000000E+00,  0.00000000E+00, -7.45375000E+02,
                       4.37967000E+00])),
        transport=gas_transport(geom='atom',
                                diam=3.33,
                                well_depth=136.501,
                                dipole=2.0,
                                polar=1.0,
                                rot_relax=15.0))"""
        )
        assert type(rmg_ct_species) == type(ct_species)
```

We should replace the `fromCti` block with a `from_yaml` block with a syntax a bit like this (this example is obviously a different species)
```python
ct.Species.from_yaml(
'''name: C6H5CH3
composition: {C: 7, H: 8}
thermo:
  model: NASA7
  temperature-ranges: [100.00, 1073.72, 5000.00]
  data:
  - [2.05719474e+00, 3.12152776E-02, 3.04758250E-05, -5.05435593E-08, 
     1.81542493E-11, 3.83493690E+03, 1.65378111E+01]
  - [9.30667130E+00, 3.36713230E-02, -1.41158452E-05, 2.69973752E-09, 
    -1.93204076E-13, 5.79813528E+02, -2.68610894E+01]'''
    )
```

Note the transportDataTest.py also has a fromCti call.

- [ ] speciesTest.py
- [ ] transportDataTest.py


### How To Reproduce
Run the unit tests, specifically `test/rmgpy/speciesTest.py` 

### Expected Behavior
We wouldn't get deprecation warnings from Cantera.
comments: Would this also require setting a new lower limit to the supported Cantera version inside the environment file? I assume that this new function has not been backported to all previous versions, and there would be some new cutoff.

For a year now we have required Cantera 2.6, and `from_yaml` is [documented](https://cantera.org/documentation/docs-2.6/sphinx/html/cython/thermo.html?highlight=from_yaml#cantera.Species.from_yaml) in that version. (It already existed in 2.5.1 but was called `fromYaml`)

This issue is being automatically marked as stale because it has not received any interaction in the last 90 days. Please leave a comment if this is still a relevant issue, otherwise it will automatically be closed in 30 days.

The Python 3.9 upgrade is running into a challenge with Arm-Based Macs that could be solved by resolving this issue.

The juliacall overhaul required with Python 3.9 does not work when running in x86 emulation mode on Apple Silicon, so we would rather run in ARM native. Cantera 2.6 does not have arm-osx builds, but the latest versions of cantera do.

This issue is being automatically marked as stale because it has not received any interaction in the last 90 days. Please leave a comment if this is still a relevant issue, otherwise it will automatically be closed in 30 days.

Updating the above comment - we can do the Python 3.9 upgrade w/o incrementing cantera, but not vice versa. Will try and get the Python 3.9 upgrade in first.

What I previously said about the missing builds was wrong, we were looking in the wrong channel.

Also important is that cantera 3.1.0 has a bug with reading surface files used in RMG. It has been resolved (https://github.com/Cantera/cantera/issues/1845#event-17345751716) but not yet released (as of writing).

This issue is being automatically marked as stale because it has not received any interaction in the last 90 days. Please leave a comment if this is still a relevant issue, otherwise it will automatically be closed in 30 days.

Another update - this upgrade was mostly completed in #2751 but abandoned because:
 - the original reason for upgrading cantera (to enable a python upgrade) was circumvented
 - there is a bug in cantera 3.3.0 that prevented reading our surface mechanisms

We can still pick up that PR and push it over the finish line, which would resolve this issue

This issue is being automatically marked as stale because it has not received any interaction in the last 90 days. Please leave a comment if this is still a relevant issue, otherwise it will automatically be closed in 30 days.

issueDTO.title: Add a `Hierarchy` struct
issueDTO.description:
I'd like to see `children` removed from `Node` and the gap filled with a new `Hierarchy` struct that is just a `NodePath` to `NodeMetadata` map.
- Better suited to parallel initialisation
- Maps well to consolidated metadata
  - Currently `zarrs` only support creating consolidated metadata, it does not use it anywhere
comments:
It would be nice to use the consolidated metadata so I wanna help getting there but I'm a bit confused (also because I'm not proficient in Rust).

I imagine this `Hierarchy` map being created on `Node::open()` and perhaps  `{Array,Group}Builder::build()`.

- Is the goal to still have it as an attribute on the Node struct, something like:
  
    ```rust
    struct Hierarchy(Arc<RwLock<BtreeMap<NodePath, NodeMetadata>>>)
    struct Node {
      path: NodePath,
      metadata: NodeMetadata,
      hierarchy: Hierarchy,
    }
    ```
   and in this case subgroup `Node`s will share this `Hierarchy`?!

 - Have it owned by the `TStorage` (I'm not sure this is an option)?! I believe in this case `Array` and specially `Group` would benefit via their `TStorage`.

 - Is the goal to have `Node` superseded in some way by `Hierarchy`? And so  wrap `Hierarchy::open()` or `Node::open()`!?

> It would be nice to use the consolidated metadata so I wanna help getting there

Excellent! Thank you for looking into this.

The problem with `Node` is that it is a recursive struct, which is annoying to initialise concurrently, and to interact with. So I think a `Hierarchy` struct would supersede the `Node` API, but `Node` doesn't have to be removed.

> Is the goal to still have it as an attribute on the Node struct, something like:

Nope, just an independent `struct Hierarchy(...)`

> Have it owned by the `TStorage`

Interesting question. If it were just a struct like you suggested, then it doesn't need to be. It would just need a constructor that is generic on `TStorage`. However, if the `Hierarchy` owns the store it is created from
```rust
struct Hierarchy<TStorage> {
  store: TStorage,
  hierarchy: BTreeMap<NodePath, NodeMetadata>
}
```

Then there is the advantage that there is no possibility of mixing up which store a hierarchy was created from, and `Hierarchy` could get convenience methods that call `{Array,Group}::new_with_metadata` internally for a given `NodePath`.

Thanks for the clarifications! 

Since `Array` and `Group` have themselves  a `TStorage` field I guess there's no need for `Hierarchy` to have one as well. So I drafted something along those lines: #288.

But I guess your preference is the last one:

>However, if the `Hierarchy` owns the store it is created from 
Then there is the advantage that there is no possibility of mixing up which store a hierarchy was created from, and `Hierarchy` could get convenience methods that call `{Array,Group}::new_with_metadata` internally for a given `NodePath`.

I can test that option as well but I guess that either way, the consolidation of metadata would have to go to `Hierarchy` since we need to drop any functionality involving `children` (listing!?) from `Node`.

summary.validationOrRequirement: The main requirement is to remove the `children` attribute from `Node` and create a new `Hierarchy` struct. The author suggests having the `Hierarchy` struct created on `Node::open()` and `{Array,Group}Builder::build()`. The struct should be independent of `Node` and not have a direct relationship.
summary.attemptedFixes: The author and the commenter discussed different approaches, including having the `Hierarchy` struct as an attribute on `Node`, having it owned by `TStorage`, and having it own the store it is created from. The author drafted a solution along the lines of having `Hierarchy` own the store, but the commenter is open to testing other options.
summary.otherNotes: The issue aims to remove the `children` attribute from `Node` and create a new `Hierarchy` struct that is a `NodePath` to `NodeMetadata` map. The goal is to make it parallelizable and better suited for consolidated metadata. The author suggests having the `Hierarchy` struct created on `Node::open()` and `{Array,Group}Builder::build()`. The struct would be independent of `Node` and not have a direct relationship.

issueDTO.description:
🆕🐥 Good first Issue

This issue is reserved for people who have never or only recently contributed to [Hiero](https://hiero.org) or any open source project in general. We know that creating a pull request (PR) is a major barrier for new contributors.
The goal of this issue and all other issues labeled by [**'good first issue'**](https://github.com/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+org%3Ahiero-ledger+archived%3Afalse+label%3A%22good+first+issue%22+) is to help you make your first contribution to Hiero.

## 👾 Description of the issue

Currently  in the [custom_fixed_fee.py](https://github.com/hiero-ledger/hiero-sdk-python/blob/main/src/hiero_sdk_python/tokens/custom_fixed_fee.py) file some methods are missing doc string:

    def set_amount_in_tinybars(self, amount: int) -> "CustomFixedFee":
    def set_hbar_amount(self, amount: Hbar) -> "CustomFixedFee":
    def set_denominating_token_id(self, token_id: typing.Optional["TokenId"]) -> "CustomFixedFee":
    def set_denominating_token_to_same_token(self) -> "CustomFixedFee":
    def _from_fixed_fee_proto(fixed_fee: "custom_fees_pb2.FixedFee") -> "CustomFixedFee":
    def _to_proto(self) -> "custom_fees_pb2.CustomFee":
    def _to_topic_fee_proto(self) -> "custom_fees_pb2.FixedCustomFee":
    def _validate_checksums(self, client: "Client") -> None:
    def _from_proto(cls, proto_fee: custom_fees_pb2.CustomFee) -> "CustomFixedFee":
    def __eq__(self, other: "CustomFixedFee") -> bool:

We are also missing a descriptive class docstring and module docstring.

## 💡 Solution
Add Google-style docstrings. 

For the missing docstrings for the functions, the docstrings should explain:

- What the function does
- Arguments (Args:) ??? their types and purpose
- Returns (Returns:) ??? what the function returns
- Raises (Raises:) ??? any errors or exceptions that might be raised

You can follow the examples of other functions in the SDK ([token_allowance.py](https://github.com/hiero-ledger/hiero-sdk-python/blob/main/src/hiero_sdk_python/tokens/token_allowance.py))

Similarly for the class and the module docstring 

## Acceptance Criteria:
- [ ] All functions have a google-style docstring
- [ ] The class has a google-style docstring
- [ ] the module has a google-style docstring

### Implementation
- [ ] Add google style docstrings throughout

### Additional requirements to Pass
- [ ] Short but descriptive changelog entry under 'UNRELEASED'
- [ ] Verified commits achieved (see CONTRIBUTING.md and signing.md)

### Next steps
  - [ ] Comment below that you???d like to work on this issue.
  - [ ] Wait to be assigned by a maintainer.
  - [ ] Read [CONTRIBUTING.md](https://github.com/hiero-ledger/hiero-sdk-python/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md)
 to start forking and developing.


If you have never contributed to an open source project at GitHub, the following step-by-step guide will introduce you to the workflow.
More information and concrete samples for shell commands for each step can be found in our [CONTRIBUTING.md](https://github.com/hiero-ledger/.github/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md)
 file.
A more detailed general documentation of the GitHub PR workflow can be found [here](https://github.com/firstcontributions/first-contributions/blob/master/README.md)
.

For Python-specific contributing guidelines, see:

[CONTRIBUTING.md](https://github.com/hiero-ledger/hiero-sdk-python/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md)
