issueDTO.title: Add support for currently unsupported postgres json/jsonb functions
issueDTO.description:
Diesel currently supports the postgres array types. We do not provide built-in support for [various methods](https://www.postgresql.org/docs/current/functions-json.html) available for these types. This is a tracking issue for adding support for these methods. 

The general strategy for adding support for new methods is as following:

1. Define the function in [this](https://github.com/diesel-rs/diesel/blob/a641d7cc5f792412ded9ffdab3134fa473a57596/diesel/src/pg/expression/functions.rs#L20) `extern "SQL` block. This function should have a short documentation snippet with an example (See the linked postgres documentation for examples for all of the function, please also add variants with null values, etc). If there is a `json` and a `jsonb` variant, please implement both in a single PR.
2. If the function is generic, add a helper type definition [here](https://github.com/diesel-rs/diesel/blob/6c1cb1d42eb2b3000502d67249dc3cdd76066dd7/diesel/src/pg/expression/helper_types.rs#L351-L354). Again see the linked definition for an example for the `array_append` function.
3. Add a test for  `#[auto_type]` support for the newly added function [here](https://github.com/diesel-rs/diesel/blob/6c1cb1d42eb2b3000502d67249dc3cdd76066dd7/diesel_derives/tests/auto_type.rs#L413)
5. Submit a PR with the change

Method list:

- [x] `to_json ( anyelement ) ??? json` Converts any SQL value to json. *
- [x] `to_jsonb ( anyelement ) ??? jsonb` Converts any SQL value to jsonb. *
- [x] `array_to_json ( anyarray [, boolean ] ) ??? json` Converts an SQL array to a JSON array.*
- [ ] `json_array ( [ { value_expression [ FORMAT JSON ] } [, ...] ] [ { NULL | ABSENT } ON NULL ] [ RETURNING data_type [ FORMAT JSON [ ENCODING UTF8 ] ] ])`  Constructs a JSON array from either a series of value_expression parameters or from the results of query_expression ***
- [ ] `json_array ( [ query_expression ] [ RETURNING data_type [ FORMAT JSON [ ENCODING UTF8 ] ] ])` Constructs a JSON array from either a series of value_expression parameters or from the results of query_expression ***
- [x] `row_to_json ( record [, boolean ] ) ??? json` Converts an SQL composite value to a JSON object. **
- [ ] `json_build_array ( VARIADIC "any" ) ??? json` Builds a possibly-heterogeneously-typed JSON array out of a variadic argument list.  ***
- [ ] `jsonb_build_array ( VARIADIC "any" ) ??? jsonb`  Builds a possibly-heterogeneously-typed JSON array out of a variadic argument list.  ***
- [ ] `json_object ( [ { key_expression { VALUE | ':' } value_expression [ FORMAT JSON [ ENCODING UTF8 ] ] }[, ...] ] [ { NULL | ABSENT } ON NULL ] [ { WITH | WITHOUT } UNIQUE [ KEYS ] ] [ RETURNING data_type [ FORMAT JSON [ ENCODING UTF8 ] ] ])` Constructs a JSON object of all the key/value pairs given, or an empty object if none are given.  ***
- [x] `json_object ( text[] ) ??? json` Builds a JSON object out of a text array.  *
- [x] `jsonb_object ( text[] ) ??? jsonb` Builds a JSON object out of a text array. *
- [x] `json_object ( keys text[], values text[] ) ??? json` This form of json_object takes keys and values pairwise from separate text arrays. *
- [x] `jsonb_object ( keys text[], values text[] ) ??? jsonb` This form of json_object takes keys and values pairwise from separate text arrays. *
- [ ] `json_array_elements ( json ) ??? setof json` Expands the top-level JSON array into a set of JSON values. ***
- [ ] `jsonb_array_elements ( jsonb ) ??? setof jsonb`  Expands the top-level JSON array into a set of JSON values. ***
- [ ] `json_array_elements_text ( json ) ??? setof text`  Expands the top-level JSON array into a set of text values. ***
- [ ] `jsonb_array_elements_text ( jsonb ) ??? setof text` Expands the top-level JSON array into a set of text values. ***
- [x] `json_array_length ( json ) ??? integer` Returns the number of elements in the top-level JSON array. *
- [x] `jsonb_array_length ( jsonb ) ??? integer` Returns the number of elements in the top-level JSON array. *
- [ ] `json_each ( json ) ??? setof record ( key text, value json )` Expands the top-level JSON object into a set of key/value pairs.***
- [ ] `jsonb_each ( json ) ??? setof record ( key text, value json )` Expands the top-level JSON object into a set of key/value pairs.***
- [ ] `json_each_text ( json ) ??? setof record ( key text, value text )` Expands the top-level JSON object into a set of key/value pairs. The returned values will be of type text. ***
- [ ] `jsonb_each_text ( jsonb ) ??? setof record ( key text, value text )` Expands the top-level JSON object into a set of key/value pairs. The returned values will be of type text. ***
- [ ] `json_extract_path ( from_json json, VARIADIC path_elems text[] ) ??? json` Extracts JSON sub-object at the specified path. ***
- [ ] `jsonb_extract_path ( from_json jsonb, VARIADIC path_elems text[] ) ??? jsonb` Extracts JSON sub-object at the specified path. ***
- [ ] `json_extract_path_text ( from_json json, VARIADIC path_elems text[] ) ??? text` Extracts JSON sub-object at the specified path as text. ***
- [ ] `jsonb_extract_path_text ( from_json jsonb, VARIADIC path_elems text[] ) ??? text` Extracts JSON sub-object at the specified path as text. ***
- [ ] `json_object_keys ( json ) ??? setof text` Returns the set of keys in the top-level JSON object. ***
- [ ] `jsonb_object_keys ( jsonb ) ??? setof text` Returns the set of keys in the top-level JSON object. ***
- [x] `json_populate_record ( base anyelement, from_json json ) ??? anyelement` Expands the top-level JSON object to a row having the composite type of the base argument.  *
- [x] `jsonb_populate_record ( base anyelement, from_json jsonb ) ??? anyelement` Expands the top-level JSON object to a row having the composite type of the base argument.  *
- [ ] `json_populate_recordset ( base anyelement, from_json json ) ??? setof anyelement` Expands the top-level JSON array of objects to a set of rows having the composite type of the base argument ***
- [ ] `jsonb_populate_recordset ( base anyelement, from_json jsonb ) ??? setof anyelement` Expands the top-level JSON array of objects to a set of rows having the composite type of the base argument ***
- [ ] `json_to_record ( json ) ??? record` Expands the top-level JSON object to a row having the composite type defined by an AS clause. ****
- [ ] `jsonb_to_record ( jsonb ) ??? record` Expands the top-level JSON object to a row having the composite type defined by an AS clause. ****
- [ ] `json_to_recordset ( json ) ??? setof record` Expands the top-level JSON array of objects to a set of rows having the composite type defined by an AS clause. ***
- [ ] `jsonb_to_recordset ( jsonb ) ??? setof record` Expands the top-level JSON array of objects to a set of rows having the composite type defined by an AS clause. ***
- [x] `jsonb_set ( target jsonb, path text[], new_value jsonb [, create_if_missing boolean ] ) ??? jsonb` Returns target with the item designated by path replaced by new_value, or with new_value added if create_if_missing is true *
- [x] `jsonb_set_lax ( target jsonb, path text[], new_value jsonb [, create_if_missing boolean [, null_value_treatment text ]] ) ??? jsonb` If new_value is not NULL, behaves identically to jsonb_set. Otherwise behaves according to the value of null_value_treatment which must be one of 'raise_exception', 'use_json_null', 'delete_key', or 'return_target' * (we want an enum for the `null_value_treatment` parameter)
- [x] `jsonb_insert ( target jsonb, path text[], new_value jsonb [, insert_after boolean ] ) ??? jsonb` Returns target with new_value inserted. If the item designated by the path is an array element *
- [x] `json_strip_nulls ( json ) ??? json` Deletes all object fields that have null values from the given JSON value, recursively.*
- [x] `jsonb_strip_nulls ( jsonb ) ??? jsonb` Deletes all object fields that have null values from the given JSON value, recursively.*
- [ ] `jsonb_path_exists ( target jsonb, path jsonpath [, vars jsonb [, silent boolean ]] ) ??? boolean` Checks whether the JSON path returns any item for the specified JSON value.*
- [ ] `jsonb_path_match ( target jsonb, path jsonpath [, vars jsonb [, silent boolean ]] ) ??? boolean` Returns the result of a JSON path predicate check for the specified JSON value. *
- [ ] `jsonb_path_query ( target jsonb, path jsonpath [, vars jsonb [, silent boolean ]] ) ??? setof jsonb` Returns all JSON items returned by the JSON path for the specified JSON value.***
- [ ] `jsonb_path_query_array ( target jsonb, path jsonpath [, vars jsonb [, silent boolean ]] ) ??? jsonb` Returns all JSON items returned by the JSON path for the specified JSON value, as a JSON array.  *
- [ ] `jsonb_path_query_first ( target jsonb, path jsonpath [, vars jsonb [, silent boolean ]] ) ??? jsonb` Returns the first JSON item returned by the JSON path for the specified JSON value. Returns NULL if there are no results. *
- [ ] `jsonb_path_exists_tz ( target jsonb, path jsonpath [, vars jsonb [, silent boolean ]] ) ??? boolean` These functions act like their counterparts described above without the _tz suffix, except that these functions support comparisons of date/time values that require timezone-aware conversions. *
- [ ] `jsonb_path_match_tz ( target jsonb, path jsonpath [, vars jsonb [, silent boolean ]] ) ??? boolean` These functions act like their counterparts described above without the _tz suffix, except that these functions support comparisons of date/time values that require timezone-aware conversions. *
- [ ] `jsonb_path_query_tz ( target jsonb, path jsonpath [, vars jsonb [, silent boolean ]] ) ??? setof jsonb` These functions act like their counterparts described above without the _tz suffix, except that these functions support comparisons of date/time values that require timezone-aware conversions. ***
- [ ] `jsonb_path_query_array_tz ( target jsonb, path jsonpath [, vars jsonb [, silent boolean ]] ) ??? jsonb` These functions act like their counterparts described above without the _tz suffix, except that these functions support comparisons of date/time values that require timezone-aware conversions. *
- [ ] `jsonb_path_query_first_tz ( target jsonb, path jsonpath [, vars jsonb [, silent boolean ]] ) ??? jsonb` These functions act like their counterparts described above without the _tz suffix, except that these functions support comparisons of date/time values that require timezone-aware conversions. *
- [x] `jsonb_pretty ( jsonb ) ??? text` Converts the given JSON value to pretty-printed, indented text*
- [x] `json_typeof ( json ) ??? text` Returns the type of the top-level JSON value as a text string. Possible types are object, array, string, number, boolean, and null.*
- [x] `jsonb_typeof ( jsonb ) ??? text` Returns the type of the top-level JSON value as a text string. Possible types are object, array, string, number, boolean, and null.*

For items marked with * the instructions above can be followed as written down

For items marked with ** we want try to use the `sql_type::Record` type as input type, although I'm not 100% sure if that will work. 

For items marked with *** are variadic functions and need to be marked with a `#[variadic(2)]` attribute. The number specifies how many arguments starting from the end are variadic.

Items marked with **** need additional non-straighforward handling for the returned record type as outlined in the postgres documentation (we would need to find a way to generate the cast)

In addition diesel does currently not support the `expression IS [ NOT ] JSON [ { VALUE | SCALAR | ARRAY | OBJECT } ] [ { WITH | WITHOUT } UNIQUE [ KEYS ] ]` operator variants. For this we need

* Add a new `diesel_infix/suffic_operator()` definition [here](https://github.com/diesel-rs/diesel/blob/master/diesel/src/pg/expression/operators.rs)
* Add a new method constructing that operator to [this trait](https://github.com/diesel-rs/diesel/blob/master/diesel/src/pg/expression/expression_methods.rs#L20). We want a short documentation snippet with an example usage here.
* Run compile tests with `cd diesel_compile_tests && TRYBUILD=overwrite cargo test` to update the output there

We want variants for:

- [x] `expression IS JSON` (suffix operator)
- [x] `expression IS NOT JSON` (suffix operator)
- [x] `expression IS JSON OBJECT` (suffix operator)
- [x] `expression IS JSON ARRAY` (suffix operator)
- [x] `expression IS JSON SCALAR` (suffix operator)
- [x] `expression IS NOT JSON OBJECT` (suffix operator)
- [x] `expression IS NOT JSON ARRAY` (suffix operator)
- [x] `expression IS NOT JSON SCALAR` (suffix operator)
- [ ] Maybe variants with `WITH/WITHOUT UNIQUE $key_array" as infix operators


Please add a comment to this issue if you plan to work on a specific method.

If there is anything unclear about how to add a support for a specific method just ask and we will try to answer your questions.

1 accessibility violation was found in the `Input`.

### Target stories

#### [Components / Input / Element](https://yamada-ui.github.io/yamada-ui/?path=/story/components-input--element)

Received:
Select element must have an accessible name (select-name)

Fix any of the following:
  Element does not have an implicit (wrapped) <label>
  Element does not have an explicit <label>
  aria-label attribute does not exist or is empty
  aria-labelledby attribute does not exist, references elements that do not exist or references elements that are empty
  Element has no title attribute
  Element's default semantics were not overridden with role="none" or role="presentation"

You can find more information on this issue here: 
https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/4.11/select-name?application=axeAPI

### Additional Information
While it's ideal to cover all tests, if there are too many lines to work on, please create a PR within your capacity.
Any deficiencies not covered by the PR will be automatically created as issues.

issueDTO.title: Go-to-definition / Find references for `meck` calls
issueDTO.description:
# Context

ELP has support for go-to-definition and find-references for *dynamic calls* such as `erlang:apply/X` or `erlang:spawn/X`.

[meck](https://github.com/eproxus/meck) is a popular mocking library which also takes Erlang MFAs (module-function-arity or module-function-arguments) as parameters. 

# Problem

While it's possible to navigate and find references for certain dynamic calls, this is not possible for meck.

# Solution

ELP already provides a mechanism to support dynamic calls in go-to-definition/find-reference. The details are described [here](https://github.com/WhatsApp/erlang-language-platform/blob/d6f2636f015069ed32137a42f99b9b2ecbaa35a9/crates/hir/src/sema/to_def.rs#L818).

Extend the list to support `meck` APIs which take a MFA as "argument".

Tests can be trivially implemented [here](https://github.com/WhatsApp/erlang-language-platform/blob/d6f2636f015069ed32137a42f99b9b2ecbaa35a9/crates/ide/src/rename.rs#L2001).

issueDTO.title: [🐛 BUG] Default table "editable" behaviour broken when df has index
issueDTO.description:
### 🔍 What went wrong?

Example code:

```python
import pandas as pd
import taipy.gui.builder as tgb
from taipy.gui import Gui

df = pd.DataFrame({"A": ["a1", "a2", "a3"], "B": ["b1", "b2", "b3"]})
df.set_index("A", inplace=True)

with tgb.Page() as page:
    tgb.table("{df}", editable=True)

if __name__ == "__main__":
    gui = Gui(page=page)
    gui.run(title="Default editable behaviour broken when dataframe has index")
```

Delete and add print following warnings:

```
/project/.venv-4.1.0/lib/python3.10/site-packages/taipy/gui/gui.py:1794: TaipyGuiWarning: Gui.table_on_add() failed potentially from a table's on_add callback.:
can only concatenate str (not "int") to str
  _warn("Gui.table_on_add() failed potentially from a table's on_add callback.", e)
/project/.venv-4.1.0/lib/python3.10/site-packages/taipy/gui/gui.py:1810: TaipyGuiWarning: Gui.table_on_delete() failed potentially from a table's on_delete callback.:
'[0] not found in axis'
  _warn("Gui.table_on_delete() failed potentially from a table's on_delete callback.", e)
```

Edit doesn't modify the edited cell and instead appends a new row

### 📦 Taipy Version

4.1

### 📋 Additional Context (Optional)

```bash

```

issueDTO.title: Adopters
issueDTO.description:
Django-guardian is used in very many projects (GitHub suggests that there are over 2,000) - both commercial and non-commercial, both closed-source and open-source.

I think it will be helpful to show these projects in the README library / separate documentation section to inspire the confidence of potential library users regarding its adaptation in the Django community and its high maturity.

This can contribute to library marketing, but also - in the case of open-source projects - to inspire users who are trying to understand how to use it. Maybe this will help when designing the library API in the future.

To start with, I suggest in the comments to this issue to share the names of the projects and, if possible, links to them. After some time it will be collected and published in the right place.
comments:
We can also show the ecosystem in the form of libraries. To get started:

- https://github.com/rpkilby/django-rest-framework-guardian

issueDTO.title: [FEATURE] make `--setup` the default behavior and deprecate the flag
issueDTO.description:
Currently several subcommands our CLI (`update`, `server`) accepts a `--setup`. Since `--setup` needs to be confirmed by users when there's any change needed, it's actually pretty safe if we always turn on `--setup`.

From now on, we want to always automatically execute setup-related logic for these subcommands, regardless of the `--setup` flag.

We still want to keep the `--setup` flag for a while for backward compatibility (users may have some script passing this flag in), but whenever users explicitly turned on `--setup`, output a warning to tell users it's deprecated.


---
?????? Contributors, please refer to 📙[Contributing Guide](https://cocoindex.io/docs/about/contributing).
Unless the PR can be sent immediately (e.g. just a few lines of code), we recommend you to leave a comment on the issue like **`I'm working on it`**  or **`Can I work on this issue?`** to avoid duplicating work. Our [Discord server](https://discord.com/invite/zpA9S2DR7s) is always open and friendly.
comments: Hi! Could I be assigned this issue?

repository.description: Data transformation framework for AI. Ultra performant, with incremental processing.  🌟 Star if you like it!
repository.name: cocoindex

issueDTO.title: add to_json method for SetValueTransformer
issueDTO.description:
What?
want to make it so that transformers can be dumped to/built from json - to do this in this case just need to add a to_json method which:

- calls super.to_json()
- adds the additional init attrs (`value`) to this dict
- Then need to add test cases for transforms with to/from json-ed transformers - this can be done fairly easily with parametrise and following the example in this PR https://github.com/azukds/tubular/pull/496

Will need to:
- set the jsonable class attr to True
- add the `block_from_json` decorator to any instance methods that are not needed for transform
- set up and transform tests for this class to do an additional run for json'd transformers, following the PR example

Why?
Provide a more readable and env independent way of storing pipelines/transformers
comments: Hi! Could I please be assigned to this issue? I'd love to take a look at it.
Welcome @KatheeO! sure :) I would start by having a read of the linked PR, and then happy to answer any Qs you may have after that!
this PR may be a useful example to follow https://github.com/azukds/tubular/pull/566
Thanks, I'll check it out!

repository.description: Python package implementing transformers for pre processing steps for machine learning.
repository.name: tubular

issueDTO.title: Ungodly slow tests
issueDTO.description:
Locally when I utilize all cores and threads, `make test` runs for ~11m.
I ran the output of it through a quick script that I wrote to check what test takes the longest and I found that there are some tests that are big bottlenecks:

This is a minor issue, but `make test` can probably be sped up by 1) choosing a smart ordering of what test is executed first (bottlenecks first), and 2) making some of the bottleneck tests more computationally efficient

issueDTO.title: Add a workflow for publishing Helm charts
issueDTO.description:
### What you would like to be added?

Add a GitHub action workflow for:

- Publishing helm charts to GHCR, so user can install the trainer Helm chart by specifying OCI image repository and version:

  ```bash
  helm install kubeflow-trainer oci://ghcr.io/kubeflow/helm-charts/kubeflow-trainer
      --version 2.0.0 \
      --namespace kubeflow-system \
      --create-namespace
  ```

- (Optional) Using GH page to host the Helm charts index file `index.yaml`, so users are able to add trainer as a Helm chart repo like:

  ```bash
  helm repo add kubeflow-trainer https://kubeflow.github.io/trainer
  ```

  In this way, users only need to add the Helm repo once and then they can:

  ```
  # Update Helm repo index
  helm repo update

  # Search repo for available versions of kubeflow-trainer
  helm search repo kubeflow-trainer --versions
  
  # Install the latest version
  helm install kubeflow-trainer kubeflow-trainer/kubeflow-trainer \
      --namespace kubeflow-system \
      --create-namespace

  # Install a specified version
  helm install kubeflow-trainer kubeflow-trainer/kubeflow-trainer \
      --version 2.0.0 \
      --namespace kubeflow-system \
      --create-namespace
  ```

### Why is this needed?

Set a workflow to publish Helm charts automatically.

### Love this feature?

Give it a 👍 We prioritize the features with most 👍

issueDTO.title: Support printing errors only to the log.html file and not to the console
issueDTO.description:
In our tests using Robot Framework, we record a video while the test is executed and want to attach that video to the log.html file when the test fails.

That works fine when printing the video in webm format as base64 via `logger.error`. The video is then displayed in the "Test Execution Errors" section. The problem we're facing is that this base64 encoded video is also printed on the console, which produces a lot of useless output which you need to scroll through to get to the actual error messages about the test failure. So what we want is a way to attach the video to the log.html file without printing it to the console.

One option we discussed with @pekkaklarck on Slack is to add an optional `also_console=True` argument to `logger.error` (and `logger.warn`), similar to the `also_console=False` argument which `logger.info` already supports, except for the default value (`True` instead of `False`).
comments: Sounds good and should be rather trivial to implement. We are planning to release RF 7.4 in mid-July and if someone creates a PR, this could be included into it.
Hello, can I know what the progress is on this? We are waiting for this feature :D
It's already implemented in https://github.com/robotframework/robotframework/pull/5462, just waiting for review

repository.description: Generic automation framework for acceptance testing and RPA
repository.name: robotframework

summary.main: Implement an optional argument in `logger.error` and `logger.warn` to print errors only to the log.html file and not to the console, for attaching videos in Robot Framework tests.
summary.validationOrRequirement: The issue requires a way to attach video to log.html file without printing it to the console, and the proposed solution needs to be implemented and reviewed.
summary.attemptedFixes: An optional `also_console=True` argument was proposed for `logger.error` and `logger.warn` to achieve the desired behavior, similar to `logger.info`.
summary.otherNotes: The issue is related to printing errors to log.html file and not to the console, specifically for video attachments in Robot Framework tests. The author discussed an optional argument with @pekkaklarck on Slack.

issueDTO.title: Feature request: show container names
issueDTO.description:
Hi, i'v tested out lazydocker today and i love it!
A feature to have is to have names on the containers where the `Services` window is.

I have a `docker-compose.yml` file:

```
version: '3.7'

services:
  mongodb:
    image: mongo
    container_name: "db_app"
    ports:
      - "27017:27017"

  frontend:
    image: quizgame/webclient
    container_name: "web_app"
    build:
      context: .
      dockerfile: Dockerfile
    ports:
      - "8080:3000"
    environment:
      - NODE_ENV=docker
    depends_on:
      - mongodb
```


In `Services` window, there is to running containers.

```
running frontend 0.00%
running mongodb 0.35%
```

It should be:

```
running frontend (web_app) 0.00%
running mongodb (db_app) 0.35%
```

Love this tool!
comments:
Sounds like a reasonable request. Given that there if often not much horizontal space, I'm inclined to make this a user configurable thing that defaults to false. Something like:
```
gui:
  showContainerName: true
```
What are your thoughts on that approach?

As for implementation, It would be fairly trivial to write the code, it would just be a matter of changing the GetDisplayStrings() function in `pkg/commands/service.go`. I'm happy to label this as Good First Issue and see if anybody wants to pick it up (I'm happy to lend a hand) :)

Nice to hear :)

My thoughts is, make it default:

```
gui:
    showContainerName: true
```

And if someone dont want the container name then they can set it to `false`.
If if there is no more space in horizontal then you can show like these examples:

`running thisIsNameOfService (..) 0.00%` (service name is long then add (..) to container name
same on the other way.

And when you click on this service it will show a header on the left windows where `Logs, Stats, Container Config, Top` is and show the container name on the header.

My $0.02: I don't really want or need to see the container name in the sidebar (in the header of the main panel would be great though!) **unless** the service has a dynamic container_name.  Knowing what directory lazydocker is running in would be more useful.

My primary use case is in development, where I run a few distinct projects that share service names.  My services have static container names to make linking them together easier, and I'm never running a service as more than a single instance.  If/when I cannot supply a container name (e.g. swarms), I'd still like to see the *service* listed, along with the specific containers.
@jesseduffield Yeah, i think thats a better suggestion :)

@jesseduffield I would have suggested putting it in that status panel, but I didn't want to suggest losing the branding!

As for dynamic container names, I'm more or less working from the definition "the docker-compose service does not specify a `container_name` key".  That may not be perfectly adequate, but it seems like a good starting point.

Given that Container names may be long, and Services may have multiple containers associated with them, I'm increasingly inclined towards a UI like this:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2350/61998212-95059c80-b061-11e9-9435-d2ccd69f8a52.png)

I would be curious to hear what other people think of this, and how other people would expect it to work.  If there's enough interest in this approach, I may go ahead and try to move it forward myself...
Happy to have a look into this over christmas break if that's ok
Please, go ahead.
Hi, is anyone working on it, otherwise I would like to pick this up

I belive we can close this right? now days we show the container name

![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/cb2f4921-2b02-46b0-b18f-88729026881f)

@loopsFreitag It does seem container names are shown in the general case, but not all. In some cases, I see `ubi8` and I don't know where it comes from, although this discussion thread https://github.com/jesseduffield/lazydocker/discussions/524 suggests it comes from the label block, which I don't see.
@huyz Yes, that is true, today we prioratize taking this information from the container labels, i made a small PR to change this behavior https://github.com/jesseduffield/lazydocker/pull/625
@loopsFreitag great, thanks!

Hi,
why is the PR for this issue not merged yet? I run into this same issue and it would be great to see the container name instead of the `Labels.Name` field.

issueDTO.title: Add switch for warm water circulation pump
issueDTO.description:
Would it be possible to add a switch for the warm water circulation pump?

Would be very usefull for energy conserving and demand driven (instead of time based) circulation control.

Could also help as a work around for manual thermal disinfection.
comments:
I solved that with an outlet (zigbee - zha) and a motion sensor.
I know that is not the smartest solution but it works

Right, there are many ways to control the circulation pump (or virtually any component) by external devices, but IMO that is not the point of this integration. Additionally, I prefer software solutions over altering the hardware whenever possible.

There is a point in the control menu where you can switch the pump manually for venting and I was wondering if that is reachable via the interface.

> Right, there are many ways to control the circulation pump (or virtually any component) by external devices, but IMO that is not the point of this integration. Additionally, I prefer software solutions over altering the hardware whenever possible.
> 
> There is a point in the control menu where you can switch the pump manually for venting and I was wondering if that is reachable via the interface. 

That would be awesome 👍 
I also tried to turn on the circulation pump outside the normal interval. But currently no success.
Do you know which luxtronik write command I have to send? Or how do I research of it?

> 
> Could also help as a work around for manual thermal disinfection.

I have learned from the author that thermal desinfection is just like any other water heating mode. Since then i don't care about how it is called, i just increase it whenever i want, especially when i have a lot of solar overproduction just to store more energy in the house. 

https://github.com/BenPru/luxtronik/issues/263
@apf-doit and how do you do it? Via luxtronik write command or custom automation? I have no entities, that set this mode directly.

@Gifford47 i have an entity named "number.luxtronik2_dhw_target_temperature" which basically is what it says it is: domestic water temperature. Combined with an automation checking the solar production and few other checks like current energy price, i increase the temp from default 45 to 60 and turn back when the temp is reached. The default desinfection target temp is actually 65, but with that entity i cannot set above 60, don't know why. But 60 is hot enough.

I have been using "ID_Einst_BWZIP_akt" for a while now to somewhat successfully turn off the hot water circulation pump. It's set to 0 by default and kind of disables it when set to 1. However the pump can still turn itself on sometimes and then run for even 20min non stop, ignoring the circulation timings settings. It usually happens after it's been off for a few hours.

Despite that it successfully reduces the energy usage. Usually by more than 50%.

> I have been using "ID_Einst_BWZIP_akt" for a while now to somewhat successfully turn off the hot water circulation pump. It's set to 0 by default and kind of disables it when set to 1. However the pump can still turn itself on sometimes and then run for even 20min non stop, ignoring the circulation timings settings. It usually happens after it's been off for a few hours.
> 
> Despite that it successfully reduces the energy usage. Usually by more than 50%.

May I ask how you disable or enable the hot water circulation pump? I think the "ID_Einst_BWZIP_akt" is not in the current implementation from BenPru. But I can add it via Bouni and YAML. right?

@Mehli12 
Yeah, looks like I managed it with the integration by Bouni.
I monitor it's state with a sensor added in the configuration file:
```
sensor:
  - platform: luxtronik
    sensors:
      - group: parameters
        id: ID_Einst_BWZIP_akt
        friendly_name: Circulation Pump
```

An change it's value with the `luxtronik.write` action:
```
action: luxtronik.write
data:
  parameter: ID_Einst_BWZIP_akt
  value: 1
```

However, the post I made actually inspired me to find a more reliable way to disable the circulation pump. I realized it could work more seamlessly with the heat pump if I used the integration to modify the circulation **schedule** instead of just turning it off directly.

With a bit of help from Gemini, I figured out the parameters used for the matrix that stores circulation start and end times (in seconds from midnight). The IDs follow this pattern:

**ID_Einst_SuZIP + Wo/25/Tg + _zeit_X_Y**

- The first part indicates it???s a schedule for the circulation pump.  
- The second part defines the type of schedule:  
  - `Wo` ??? same for every day  
  - `25` ??? different for weekends  
  - `Tg` ??? different for each day (just like in the heat pump settings)  
- The last part defines the coordinates in the matrix:  
  - `X` is the row (values 0???4)  
  - `Y` is the column:  
    - `0` = start time, `1` = end time for day 1  
    - `2` = start time, `3` = end time for day 2, and so on  

For example, `ID_Einst_SuZIP25_zeit_0_2` refers to the **start time for the weekend schedule on day 2**.

So, instead of completely disabling the circulation pump, I now modify the schedule based on presence. When everyone leaves, the schedule changes from the normal 6:00???00:00 to just **on at 6:00 and off at 6:15**. I use the same `luxtronik.write` action as before. This method has proven to be much more reliable for keeping the pump off when it???s not needed.

Additionally, if no one is home at 5:58, I change the schedule to end at **5:55**, and start at **5:50**, wait 18 minutes, then switch it back to the usual 6:00???6:15. I update the **end time first**. The system handles this well???even if the end time is earlier than the start time. For instance, if the start time is 6:00 and the end time is 5:00, the pump runs from 6:00 **until 5:00 the next day** and **doesn't run** from 5:00 to 6:00.

So I've been using that **instead of** `ID_Einst_BWZIP_akt` for the past few days and I think it's going to stay that way.
@BenPru is it possible to impliment this Switch into your Addon

When adding the entity, please provide a bit of documentation on how the parameter should be used. Some of these parameters are not very intuitive, can cause unexpected behavior or reduce the efficiency when not properly used. We really need to capture the information in this topic so it can be found again.

@felixs2103 I have added the switch to branch #310. Please test it in this.
Todo: Add other translations.
@BenPru @felixs2103 If this works Ok and is ready to be merged, please create a PR.

> [@BenPru](https://github.com/BenPru) [@felixs2103](https://github.com/felixs2103) If this works Ok and is ready to be merged, please create a PR.

I can't activate the circulation pump using the switches. #310 doesn't work for me.
I read that ModBus Register 10070 The hot water circulation turns on and off. Is the register already included?

With the following configuration, I can now manually turn on the ZIP for hot water. Perhaps this can be integrated as a switch. 

modbus:
..- name: heatpump_modbus
....type: tcp
....host: 192.168.178.12 # korrekte IP setzen
....port: 502
....switches:
......- name: "WP ZIP"
........slave: 1
........address: 10070
........write_type: holding
........command_on: 1
........command_off: 0

issueDTO.title: [BFW-7619][BUG] Filenames of files downloaded via PrusaLink are truncated to 8.3 characters
issueDTO.description:
### Printer model

MK4S

### Firmware version

6.2.0

### Upgrades and modifications

None

### Printing from...

PrusaLink

### Describe the bug

This one is really simple. If you have a model with a filename like:

My_Axolotl_Model.bgcode

...and you upload it to PrusaLink, it appears with that filename. But if you download it, PrusaLink sends it with the filename:

MYAXOL~1.BGC

...which, of course, is the 8.3-character truncated filename for older file systems like FAT16.

There's no reason why PrusaLink can't send the file with its full and original filename, which is obviously retained after uploading because it appears correctly in the PrusaLink file store for the printer.

### How to reproduce

Upload a file with a filename that exceeds the 8.3 format. Download the same file and observe its filename.


### Expected behavior

The file should be transmitted by PrusaLink with its full and original filename.

### Files

_No response_
comments: I just wrote a PR #4598 that will solve this issue :)
Update the small download icon under Storage works well. What does change the filename to 8.3 format is when you open the file and use the BIG DOWNLOAD button.

Thank you for your contribution to our project. This issue has not received any updates for 60 days and may be considered "stale." If this issue is still important to you, please add an update within the next 7 days to keep it open. Administrators can manually reopen the issue if necessary.
This issue has been closed due to lack of recent activity. Please consider opening a new one if needed.

summary.otherNotes: The issue was tested on MK4 and FW 6.2.4+8909, and the filename was found to be identical before and after download. The firmware version 6.2.4 was suggested as a potential solution.

issueDTO.title: Constrain the ement-room--event-mentions-user-p regexp
issueDTO.description:
At present the word `uphill` in a message is treated as mentioning the username `phil` :)

Let's at minimum wrap the pattern with word boundaries?

(Or do we then worry about usernames which do not begin/end with word characters?  Either way, I'm sure we can improve this...)
comments: Makes sense.  Thanks.

I looked to see if there were restrictions on characters used for a user's display name, and I'm not seeing anything.  Searching for `displayname` at https://spec.matrix.org/v1.8/client-server-api/ gives lots of info, but it seems like the value may be "any string".

So we can't simply wrap the quoted display name with word boundaries, but I suspect that even if the user had non-word characters at the start or end of their display name, we *could* assume that any mention of their name will have non-word characters (or bol/eol) *surrounding* the display name.  So maybe something like this:

    "\\(?:^\\|[^[:word:]]\\)\\(DISPLAYNAME\\)\\(?:$\\|[^[:word:]]\\)"

Possibly in the form of a `rx`-based template in a new variable or user option.
It's kind of hidden here: https://spec.matrix.org/v1.8/appendices/#user-identifiers

Ah, yes, we have different rules for username and displayname (I was only thinking about displayname).

At present `ement-room--event-mentions-user-p` uses the same code for both.  In fact it matches on three names... 

        (or (matches-body-p (ement-user-username user))
            (matches-body-p (ement--user-displayname-in room user))
            (matches-body-p (ement-user-id user)))))))

Where `username` is the "Username part of user's Matrix ID." in the user struct; so I guess we apply the character constraints from your spec URL to both `ement-user-username` and `ement-user-id`, and only `ement--user-displayname-in` should be the more permissive one.

IIUC, doing this would fix the issue for both username and useid, right?
```
    (or (matches-body-p (format "\\b%s\\b" (ement-user-username user)))
        (matches-body-p (ement--user-displayname-in room user))
        (matches-body-p (format "\\b%s\\b" (ement-user-id user))))))))
```
Can we do this first and deal with the user displayname after?

About the displayname, it sounds like there is no silver bullet.

For example, I think the displayname ":-) me :-)" can be considered a mention in "Hello :-) me :-)" but also in "Hello:-) me :-)".

But the displayname ". Therefore" would be matched against "Bla bla. Therefore bla bla", which seems counterintuitive.

I guess that to deal with all cases, we should provide a custom fonction that the user may define to match per own displayname, and provide one by default. My opinion would be to provide one that keep the current behavior.
@phil-s how did you mitigate that issue???

My interim workaround (which is adequate for my own use-cases) is simply:

```diff
modified   ement-room.el
@@ -4250,7 +4250,9 @@ ement-room--event-mentions-user-p
     (when body
       (cl-macrolet ((matches-body-p
                       (form) `(when-let ((string ,form))
-                                (string-match-p (regexp-quote string) body))))
+                                (string-match-p
+                                 (concat "\\b" (regexp-quote string) "\\b")
+                                 body))))
         (or (matches-body-p (ement-user-username user))
             (matches-body-p (ement--user-displayname-in room user))
             (matches-body-p (ement-user-id user)))))))
```

Thank you for answering, 

I have the same thing in my fork -> https://github.com/Konubinix/ement.el/commit/f301ff099eba4ebf48feb3a397563001f2decbb7

I wish I could find a way to avoid having to maintain a fork to make
ement.el work comfortably.

-- 
Konubinix
GPG Key    : 7439106A
Fingerprint: 5993 BE7A DA65 E2D9 06CE  5C36 75D2 3CED 7439 106A

issueDTO.title: Improve SQL tests for `list_records_from_table`
issueDTO.description:
## Description
<!-- A clear and concise description of what the problem is. -->

Poor test coverage means it's not clear what behavior results with different combinations of grouping, filtering, and sorting when listing records from tables. This means we may have unexpected behavior affecting users.

### Affects users
<!-- Give a rating. Delete all but one -->
**None**

<!-- If not "None", how does this debt affect users? -->
This is subject to change if we find that we _do_ have strange behavior with some combinations of parameters.

### Affects developers
<!-- Give a rating. Delete all but one -->
**Low**

<!-- If not "None", how does this debt affect developers? -->
Lack of test coverage on these combinations of parameters makes it difficult to verify whether behavior is changed, or what the behavior is, when working on the `msar.list_records_from_table` SQL function.

## Suggested change
<!-- What is the proposed change to the codebase. -->

Improve test coverage of the `msar.list_records_from_table` by adding more combinations of parameters for tests of that function in the `db/sql/test_sql_functions.sql` test file. The results should be specified by the same tests so that the behavior is clear.

## Additional context
<!-- Add any other context about the problem or screenshots here. -->

This replaces #798 , but see that old issue for more context.

issueDTO.title: Add `TriggerRun` Task for Dagster Plugin
issueDTO.description:
### Feature description

**Repository:** [kestra-io/plugin-dagster](http://github.com/kestra-io/plugin-dagster)

---

#### Summary

Create a new Kestra task `io.kestra.plugin.dagster.TriggerRun`, inspired by the existing [`TriggerDagRun` task from the Airflow plugin](https://kestra.io/plugins/plugin-airflow/io.kestra.plugin.airflow.dags.triggerdagrun#examples-body).  
This task should allow Kestra to trigger **Dagster job executions** (or asset materializations) through Dagster???s **GraphQL API**.

---

#### Context

While Airflow exposes a direct HTTP endpoint to trigger DAGs, Dagster relies on its **GraphQL API** (`/graphql`) to launch runs.  
Launching a run typically involves sending a GraphQL mutation (see [Dagster GraphQL docs](https://docs.dagster.io/api/graphql#launch-a-run)) that specifies:

- The **repository location** and **repository name**.
- The **job name** (or pipeline).
- An optional **run configuration** and **tags**.

This plugin would bridge Kestra and Dagster by allowing flows to programmatically start Dagster runs, poll their statuses, and retrieve results.

---

#### Example Usage

Trigger a Dagster job run with dynamic inputs and authentication:

```yaml
id: dagster
namespace: company.team

tasks:
  - id: run_dagster_job
    type: io.kestra.plugin.dagster.TriggerRun
    baseUrl: http://localhost:3000/graphql
    jobName: example_job
    repository: example_repo
    location: example_location
    wait: true
    pollFrequency: PT1S
    options:
      headers:
        Authorization: "Bearer {{ secret('DAGSTER_TOKEN') }}"
    body:
      runConfig:
        ops:
          example_op:
            config:
              param: "value"
      tags:
        source: kestra
        namespace: "{{ flow.namespace }}"
        flow: "{{ flow.id }}"
        task: "{{ task.id }}"
        execution: "{{ execution.id }}"
```

---

#### Implementation Notes

- Use **Dagster???s GraphQL `launchRun` mutation**:
  ```graphql
  mutation LaunchRun($executionParams: ExecutionParams!) {
    launchRun(executionParams: $executionParams) {
      __typename
      ... on LaunchRunSuccess {
        run {
          runId
          status
        }
      }
      ... on PythonError {
        message
        stack
      }
    }
  }
  ```
- Handle:
  - Custom headers (e.g., Bearer token, basic auth).
  - Polling until run completion (using Dagster???s `runStatus` queries).
  - Errors returned by GraphQL (especially `PythonError` responses).

---

#### References

- [Airflow `TriggerDagRun` Plugin](https://kestra.io/plugins/plugin-airflow/io.kestra.plugin.airflow.dags.triggerdagrun#examples-body)
- [Dagster GraphQL API Docs](https://docs.dagster.io/api/graphql)
- [Dagster Discussion: Triggering a Job via GraphQL](https://github.com/dagster-io/dagster/discussions/24246)
- [Dagster concepts](https://docs.dagster.io/getting-started/concepts)
- [Kestra Plugin Developer Guide](https://kestra.io/docs/plugin-developer-guide)

---

**Goal:** Provide first-class support for Dagster orchestration within Kestra by enabling job triggers and status tracking similar to Airflow???s integration. Please leave the Contributor Checklist and check it properly in your PR description 🙏
comments: Could be nice to have something like an AssetRefresh task too
Hi! @fdelbrayelle,  I'd like to work on this. Could you please assign it to me?

Hi @sachinparihar! Thank you :wave: Yes sure, go for it, I'll assign you the issue!

If you want to run the plugin locally on Kestra run through Docker:

1. Update the code of the plugin accordingly for the issue.
2. Create a shadow JAR by launching `./gradlew shadowJar` in the plugin folder
3. Copy `build/libs/*.jar` in a local plugin folder you create (let's say `~/dev/plugins`)
4. Run [Kestra on Docker](https://kestra.io/docs/installation/docker) with the following command:

```bash
docker run --pull=always --rm -it \
  -p 8080:8080 \
  --user=root \
  -v /var/run/docker.sock:/var/run/docker.sock \
  -v /tmp:/tmp \
  -v ~/dev/plugins:/app/plugins \
  kestra/kestra:latest server local
```

5. Go to http://localhost:8080/ui/main/flows/new and create a new flow with your tasks to test 🚀
Hey @sachinparihar, are there any updates on this?

Hi @MilosPaunovic, thanks for checking in! I couldn???t make much progress as expected due to the Diwali festival. I???ve been reviewing the Dagster documentation and GraphQL API to get a better understanding.
Do you still plan to work on this? We can give it some more time, but if there's no progress in the next few days, we'll have to unassign you from it.

Hi @sachinparihar,

As there hasn't been any progress or updates on this, I'll unassign you for now. However, if you do open a PR, it will be reviewed, and you'll be reassigned if no one else handles it in the meantime.

Thanks for all the efforts so far! 🍀

issueDTO.title: Add helpers to obtain Claimable Balance IDs
issueDTO.description:
CAP 23 (as part of Stellar Protocol 14 and released with Horizon 1.9.0) allows creating and claiming Claimable Balances.

Those balances are queried and claimed using their ID which can be obtained:

1. Before submitting the transaction creating the claim. The Claim ID is internally just a Hash which can be inferred even before Core accepts the transaction. A helper function would be useful in order to obtain this. :heavy_check_mark: stellar/js-stellar-base#482
2. After the transaction creating the claim is submitted (i.e. in the transaction result). However, the claimable ID is pretty buried withing the result XDR, making it hard to obtain through the raw API result. A helper would come in handy.

(2) still needs to be implemented
comments:
Hi @Shaptic!!

I recently made a dumb little [side quest](https://sq.elliotfriend.com/sq03) challenging folks to both create and claim a CB in a single transaction. I leaned heavily on the equivalent helper function from the python sdk, and just now thought to look if this was available in the js sdk.

Since it's already an issue, and is labeled `good first issue`, I think I'd like to take a stab at implementing it. What do you think?

Hi @ElliotFriend! Yeah, this is definitely a good first issue. Do note that the helper for (1) was added in stellar/js-stellar-base#482, but (2) would still be useful to anyone working with claimable balances. The PR will belong in the js-stellar-base repo, though, as that's where XDR-related goodies are handled :+1:

summary.main: Add helpers to obtain Claimable Balance IDs, specifically for before and after submitting the transaction creating the claim.
summary.validationOrRequirement: The helper function should be able to obtain Claimable Balance IDs before and after submitting the transaction creating the claim.
summary.attemptedFixes: A helper function was added in stellar/js-stellar-base#482 for (1), but (2) is still pending implementation.
summary.otherNotes: This issue is part of Stellar Protocol 14 and released with Horizon 1.9.0. The helper function is already available in the python sdk, and the issue is labeled as a good first issue.

issueDTO.title: MicroCeph: Replace :doc: with :ref: targets for internal cross-reference links (2)
issueDTO.description:
## Background

The MicroCeph how-to guide for [installing a multi-node cluster](https://canonical-microceph.readthedocs-hosted.com/latest/how-to/multi-node/#manage-the-cluster), has an internal link, under the "Manage the cluster" subsection, to the general how-to landing page. This link has been implemented using the Sphinx :doc: target, i.e. `:doc:`Howto <../how-to/index>`

This implementation works but it is not recommended practice since a change in the folder/file name would completely break the link and this would cause link checks to fail, and links to the document to break in other repositories to break. :doc: is fragile, and will break!
The benefit of using `:ref:` is that the target remains the same even if you change the file's location or name. Also, if you use `:ref:` with an anchor, you can cross-ref to a specific part of the document, `:doc:`.

## Task

 - Replace the `:doc:` target in the identified internal link in the  [installing a multi-node cluster how-to](https://canonical-microceph.readthedocs-hosted.com/latest/how-to/multi-node/#manage-the-cluster) with the rST `:ref:` role.
 - Follow the recommended [rST cross-referencing standard ](https://www.sphinx-doc.org/en/master/usage/referencing.html#ref-role) to update the link.
  - In order to use `:ref:`, you need to use labels with the `.. _some-label:` syntax above the header you want to link to/reference
  - `:ref:` and labels work hand in hand: the label creates the target, then the `:ref:` links to that target
## Resources

- [rST cross-referencing standard ](https://www.sphinx-doc.org/en/master/usage/referencing.html#ref-role)
- Follow our [documentation contributing guide](https://canonical-microceph.readthedocs-hosted.com/latest/contributing/)
- Read the [Ubuntu Code of Conduct](https://ubuntu.com/community/ethos/code-of-conduct).
- Visit the [academy website](https://documentationacademy.org/)

> [!NOTE] The current implementation uses a relative link to access the page whilst the second implementation links to the cross-reference header in the file. This means that the link will always work even in the event that we change the file name or move it to another folder.

> [!NOTE] Please claim the task here, but please work under https://github.com/canonical/microceph/issues/605 to get help and feedback from the team.

Thank you in advance for your contribution!

issueDTO.title: Log all functions on the app and allow users to download the logs for improved bug reporting.
issueDTO.description:
I suggest adding extensive logging in the app and then a button where you can download the log text file. This will help regular users to test and report issues that are more informative for the developers without needing to setup a whole Android dev environment for log collection. 

This will reduce work required from devs to identify the cause of a bug.
comments:
**Subject**: Implementation Proposal: "Logs (Report)" Button on the Settings Screen

Question for the development team:

Hello team,

To facilitate log collection from users and improve bug reporting, the following implementation is proposed:

1. On the Settings/Configuration screen (where options like "Account," "Settings," and "About" are located), add a new button with the text: "Logs (Report)".
2. When this button is pressed, it will navigate to a new screen that displays the complete application operation log (the log for the current session or recent sessions) in a scrollable text view.
3. On this same log screen, include a button with the text: "Export Report".
4. This button's function will be to create and save a text file (.txt) containing all the log content shown, allowing the user to easily share it (e.g., via email or through a file manager) with the developers.

The goal of this feature is to enable regular users to generate informative reports without needing development tools, thus speeding up bug identification and resolution.

Is this implementation technically feasible? What are your thoughts or what considerations should we keep in mind?

We look forward to your feedback.

Best regards.

Subject: Request for Assignment of Issue #316 ??? Implementation of Logs System and Export in MostroApp

---

Hello development team,

Regarding Issue #316, we have evaluated several possible solutions to implement a logs system accessible to end users while respecting the existing project structure.

After analyzing, we opted for the following solution:

Creation of logs folder in features

`Path: lib/features/logs/`

Implemented files:

`logs_menu_item.dart` ??? Menu item to access logs from the side menu.

`logs_screen.dart` ??? Screen showing all logs, with colors differentiated by type (ERROR, WARN, INFO).

`logs_service.dart` ??? Service responsible for capturing, storing, and exporting logs, including intercepting print() and global errors.

**Functionality achieved**

Captures all logs from app startup, including global errors.

Logs screen integrated into the side menu, compatible with the current visual theme.

Option to clear logs or export a clean .txt file, ready to be sent to the dev team.

Verified that in production (APK release), logs are generated correctly and the exported file is readable and useful for debugging.

**Tests and evidence**

Full tests performed in debug and release mode.

The following screenshots show the functionality in production:

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/f6b6e4db-6faa-4bbb-b36e-aecc00b374de)
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/78a0c92a-1ebc-4211-b240-0b541d7b393d)
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/c3c5a04a-803d-4321-b28b-6919de367d39)
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/c794bc00-afbe-4e0f-bfd8-5c064bcb9c0f)

---
With this implementation, end users can generate detailed logs and send them without needing to set up an Android development environment, significantly reducing the workload for devs when investigating bugs.

I request the assignment of Issue #316 to continue with this integration and gather any additional feedback from the team.

Thank you very much for your attention.

Best regards,
@Delgado74

issueDTO.title: [FEATURE] : [EBANX] Add Integrity Check Support for Authorize, PSync, Refund and RSync Flows
issueDTO.description:
### Feature Description/Summary

Integrity check is a scenario where there is a discrepancy between the amount sent in the request and the amount received from the connector, which is checked during response handling.

### Context
Integrity checks in a payments flow are critical for ensuring data consistency, correctness, and security when dealing with amounts between Hyperswitch and connectors like Adyen, Stripe, Razorpay, etc.

### Starter Tasks

- In the `handle_response` function of Authorize/PSync/Refund/RSync, you will have to call the respective functions - `get_authorise_integrity_object` for Authorize, `get_sync_integrity_object` for Payments Sync, `get_refund_integrity_object` for Refund and RSync and `get_capture_integrity_object` for Capture. 
- You would have to call these functions from `crates/hyperswitch_connectors/src/utils.rs`.
- These functions expect `amount_convertor`, `amount` and `currency`.
- You can take a look at this [PR](https://github.com/juspay/hyperswitch/pull/8075) for reference.

### Implementation Hints

- You can go to `crates/hyperswitch_connectors/src/connectors/ebanx.rs` and call the respective integrity check function as stated above in the `handle_response` function

### Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Request and Response body added for each of the flows where integrity check is applied.
- [ ] All the required GitHub checks passing
- [ ] Formatted the code using `cargo +nightly fmt --all`

### How to Test it 

- Hardcode the amount or currency field that is being passed to the connector different from the one you are passing in the request body
- This way you would be able to reproduce the integrity checks error message while testing.

### Mentor Contact

- Tag @bsayak03 [Sayak Bhattacharya] in the comments if you have any doubts/queries

### Resources 

Here are a few sample PRs : 

- https://github.com/juspay/hyperswitch/pull/8075
- https://github.com/juspay/hyperswitch/pull/8049

### Pre-Flight

#### Have you spent some time checking if this feature request has been raised before?

- [x] I checked and didn't find a similar issue

#### Have you read the Contributing Guidelines?

- [x] I have read the [Contributing Guidelines](https://github.com/juspay/hyperswitch/blob/main/docs/CONTRIBUTING.md)

### Submission Process:
- Ask the maintainers for assignment of the issue, you can request for assignment by commenting on the issue itself.
- Once assigned, submit a pull request (PR).
- Maintainers will review and provide feedback, if any. 
- Maintainers can unassign issues due to inactivity, [read more here](https://github.com/juspay/hyperswitch/wiki/Hacktoberfest-Contribution-Rules).

Refer [here](https://github.com/juspay/hyperswitch/blob/main/docs/TERMS_OF_CONTEST.md) for Terms and conditions for the contest.

issueDTO.title: Remove mavlink enum dependencies on non related library
issueDTO.description:
## Feature request

**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
In numerous place, we were using mavlink enum. Those are well defined and conveniant but they bring a hard link to mavlink that can be harmfull codewise.

Therefore, we got a recent effort to reduce this dependency : see https://github.com/ArduPilot/ardupilot/pull/23229 . In this PR, we decouple the GPS status from the mavlink enum. That lower our inclusion mess.

**Describe the solution you'd like**
We should now update our codebase to remove the mavlink GPS enum in favor of the GPS_Status enum.

Some other work could be done to make the same for EKF and other mavlink enums !

**Describe alternatives you've considered**
_A clear and concise description of any alternative solutions or features you've considered._

**Platform**
[ X ] All
[  ] AntennaTracker
[  ] Copter
[  ] Plane
[  ] Rover
[  ] Submarine

**Additional context**
_Add any other context or screenshots about the feature request here._

hi! are there any other libraries that need to be upgraded?
Is there still room to contribute on this issue?, looking for a first issue to be assigned. @peterbarker @khancyr

"Hi @khancyr and @peterbarker I'd like to work on this issue. I noticed the example link (AP_ExternalAHRS_LORD.cpp file) is now a 404. 

I'm going to start by searching the codebase for other files that still use the MAVLink GPS enums instead of the new GPS_Status enum. Could you confirm this is the right approach and point me to a specific directory to start my search?"

Quick update

Following the original issue description, I started by analyzing the example PR (#23229) to understand the required changes. Using that as a template, I found that AP_DAL_GPS.h appears to be another file that still uses the old MAVLink GPS_FIX_TYPE_ enums directly, just like the original example. I am going to start working on it .

As a follow-up, I've already implemented the fix for AP_DAL_GPS.h on my local branch. I replaced the enum value with direct number as i saw in the file changes section of PR(#23229) and the full build (./waf copter) completed successfully.

My branch is ready to be pushed for a PR as soon as you give the green light. Just let me know.
You have a green light. PRs are always welcome.

issueDTO.title: auto allowed with a type in C++
comments:
@llvm/issue-subscribers-clang-frontend

Author: Shafik Yaghmour (shafik)

<details>
We currently allow something like this in C++: https://godbolt.org/z/7fabbGfe6

```cpp
void f() {
  auto int x = 1;
}
```

It looks like this was allowed as an extension in C++ because it was valid C but I don't think it makes sense to support this anymore.
</details>

Hi!

This issue may be a good introductory issue for people new to working on LLVM. If you would like to work on this issue, your first steps are:

1. Check that no other contributor is working on this issue. If someone is assigned to the issue or claimed to be working on it, ping the person. After one week without a response, the assignee may be changed.
1. Leave a comment indicating that you are working on the issue, or just create a [pull request](https://github.com/llvm/llvm-project/pulls) after following the steps below. [Mention](https://docs.github.com/en/issues/tracking-your-work-with-issues/linking-a-pull-request-to-an-issue) this issue in the description of the pull request.
1. Fix the issue locally.
1. [Run the test suite](https://llvm.org/docs/TestingGuide.html#unit-and-regression-tests) locally. Remember that the subdirectories under `test/` create fine-grained testing targets, so you can e.g. use `make check-clang-ast` to only run Clang's AST tests.
1. Create a Git commit.
1. Run [`git clang-format HEAD~1`](https://clang.llvm.org/docs/ClangFormat.html#git-integration) to format your changes.
1. Open a [pull request](https://github.com/llvm/llvm-project/pulls) to the [upstream repository](https://github.com/llvm/llvm-project) on GitHub. Detailed instructions can be found [in GitHub's documentation](https://docs.github.com/en/pull-requests/collaborating-with-pull-requests/proposing-changes-to-your-work-with-pull-requests/creating-a-pull-request). [Mention](https://docs.github.com/en/issues/tracking-your-work-with-issues/linking-a-pull-request-to-an-issue) this issue in the description of the pull request.

If you have any further questions about this issue, don't hesitate to ask via a comment in the thread below.


@llvm/issue-subscribers-good-first-issue

Author: Shafik Yaghmour (shafik)

<details>
We currently allow something like this in C++: https://godbolt.org/z/7fabbGfe6

```cpp
void f() {
  auto int x = 1;
}
```

It looks like this was allowed as an extension in C++ because it was valid C but I don't think it makes sense to support this anymore.
</details>
> It looks like this was allowed as an extension in C++ because it was valid C but I don't think it makes sense to support this anymore.

That's not exactly the history here as I recall it: we allow it as an extension in C++11 onwards primarily because it's valid C++98, and we were trying to make as much code as possible from earlier standards modes continue to compile in later modes in order to ease the transition between language standards. But nonetheless, our diagnostic has said "will not be supported in future releases" since Clang 2.9; it seems like we should finally get around to removing the extension (or stop saying that in the diagnostic 😄)
I would like to take this one :)

summary.otherNotes: The issue was allowed as an extension in C++ because it was valid C but the author thinks it doesn't make sense to support it anymore.

```sh
  File "/prog/res/komodo/2025.10.02-py311-rhel8-numpy2/root/lib64/python3.11/site-packages/xtgeo/grid3d/grid.py", line 143, in _handle_import
    return grid_constructor(**_grid_import.from_file(gfile, fmt, **kwargs))
                              ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
  File "/prog/res/komodo/2025.10.02-py311-rhel8-numpy2/root/lib64/python3.11/site-packages/xtgeo/grid3d/_grid_import.py", line 33, in from_file
    gfile.check_file(raiseerror=IOError, raisetext=f"Cannot access file {gfile.name}")
  File "/prog/res/komodo/2025.10.02-py311-rhel8-numpy2/root/lib64/python3.11/site-packages/xtgeo/io/_file.py", line 278, in check_file
    raise raiseerror(raisetext)
OSError: Cannot access file /scratch/xxxx/<ECLROOT>.EGRID
```
Go to `Span view` on the left in the dashboard, and there you will find the error. There are other errors from the forward models that could be relevant or not the crash.

`ensemble.load_scalars(...)` can produce an empty dataframe, which then crash on this 
```python
dataframe = df.to_pandas().set_index("realization")
dataframe.columns.name = None
dataframe.index.name = "Realization"
data = dataframe.sort_index(axis=1)
```

Update: it should be possible to produce an empty dataframe in the current ert, so it would be nice to test it.

Difficult (not managed yet) to reproduce, but:
- When choosing a non gen_kw parameter (eg. the COND (FIELD) in heat_equation) - we see that we call the function "https://github.com/equinor/ert/blob/31d1e547f0de33e590fcd79037f4c00deac4cbb5/src/ert/gui/tools/plot/plot_window.py#L232" which down in the storage api ends up getting all the gen_kw (scalar) data, only to return nothing. 
- Here, we actually get the data: https://github.com/equinor/ert/blob/31d1e547f0de33e590fcd79037f4c00deac4cbb5/src/ert/gui/tools/plot/plot_window.py#L249

So, this should not happen (wasteful). But could it also be that this triggers a reading of some files in storage that are not "ready"?

- Don't call the get parameters for FIELD params
- Also, we seem to be triggering the data load two or three times when clicking on a parameter, should not be so

repository.description: ERT - Ensemble based Reservoir Tool - is designed for running ensembles of dynamical models such as reservoir models, in order to do sensitivity analysis and data assimilation. issueDTO.title: [Feature Request] Better load/build inline
issueDTO.description: Great work! I have a small suggestion. Currently, `tvm_ffi.cpp.build_inline` only accepts raw cpp/CUDA source code strings, rather than file paths. It would be useful to add a `tvm_ffi.cpp.load` function, similar to `torch.utils.cpp_extension.load`, which can directly compile from source files.
comments:
Seems like a good first issue! @DarkSharpness feel free to contribute if you have bandwidth, and I'm happy to help if you got any issues/questions.

Basically we need to extend this file: `python/tvm_ffi/cpp/load_inline.py`, and support Path-like objects.

FYI, in flashinfer the JitSpec basically implement this functionality on top of tvm-ffi: https://github.com/flashinfer-ai/flashinfer/blob/main/flashinfer/jit/core.py#L180-L280 (with functions such as `build` (for AOT) and `build_and_load` (for JIT)).

**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
IVF supports sampling rates. Currently, training and building with all involved is too slow.

There are two ways to use this function:

Both methods will meet your needs, so you can choose whichever you prefer.

issueDTO.title: [feature]:  Properly handle failures of keploy record and keploy test in Docker Compose
issueDTO.description: **Current Behavior**: When running keploy record or keploy test commands using Docker Compose, if the command fails, the process does not close properly. Instead, the logs display the entire command output, which can be confusing for users. **Expected Behavior**: 1. When keploy record or keploy test fails in Docker Compose, the process should exit cleanly. 2. Only relevant error messages should be displayed; unnecessary command output should be suppressed. **Steps to Reproduce:** 1. Run keploy record or keploy test using Docker Compose. 2. Simulate a failure (e.g., with invalid input or configuration or due to mis match in the request). 3. Observe that the process does not exit properly and prints the full command output. **How to Submit:** 1. Include a video demonstrating your solution along with your submission. 2. issueDTO.title: [Refactor] Use Builder pattern instead of constructors for Stats API classes
issueDTO.description:
### Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe

As a follow-up on https://github.com/opensearch-project/OpenSearch/issues/18723, I noticed other stats related classes should also utilize Builder pattern to initialize stats objects.

For example IndexingStats currently has 2 constructors: https://github.com/opensearch-project/OpenSearch/blob/main/server/src/main/java/org/opensearch/index/shard/IndexingStats.java#L191-L246

Stats related classes are exposed as PublicApi, and stats are frequently (or maybe once in a while but need to be) incremented, which causes backward-compatibility to break. This makes it difficult to add new metrics and evolve the API without causing significant disruption for developers who have adopted it. Each new stat forces a major version bump and requires users to update their code, even if they don't need the new metric.

Using this issue to track all such metric/stats classes to adopt to builder pattern and mark the existing public constructors to be on deprecation path. 

Reference from SearchStats: https://github.com/opensearch-project/OpenSearch/pull/18707

### Describe the solution you'd like

- List down all classes to be actioned from stats API / code dive deep
- Create builder pattern for those classes
- Mark existing constructors as deprecated

### Related component

Other

### Describe alternatives you've considered

_No response_

### Additional context

_No response_
comments: Hi @sandeshkr419 , can I work on this issue?
Thanks @pado0 for taking this, feel free to post any questions if you need help.
@sandeshkr419 Thanks for assigning this to me! I???ll reach out if I run into any difficulties. 👍

Hello, @sandeshkr419 I???m planning to work on this and would like to confirm a few details:

**First**  
I identified a few different patterns of how `Stats` classes are currently defined:  

1. **Pattern 1**: Using `Stats` as an inner class & exposed as Public API  
   - [`IndexStats`  ](https://github.com/opensearch-project/OpenSearch/blob/main/server/src/main/java/org/opensearch/action/admin/indices/stats/IndexStats.java)
   - [`RemoteTranslogTransferTracker` ](https://github.com/opensearch-project/OpenSearch/blob/main/server/src/main/java/org/opensearch/index/remote/RemoteTranslogTransferTracker.java) 

2. **Pattern 2**: Using `Stats` as an inner class & marked as internal API  
   - [`CpuUsageTracker`  ](https://github.com/opensearch-project/OpenSearch/blob/main/server/src/main/java/org/opensearch/search/backpressure/trackers/CpuUsageTracker.java)

3. **Pattern 3**: No inner `Stats` class, using constructor directly & exposed as Public API  
   - [`RefreshStats`  ](https://github.com/opensearch-project/OpenSearch/blob/main/server/src/main/java/org/opensearch/index/refresh/RefreshStats.java)

I plan to include these patterns in the scope of the builder refactor. Does that align with your expectation?
Or would you prefer that the scope only covers Pattern 1 and Pattern 2, and leaves out Pattern 3?

**Second**  
My plan is to list the target classes and define their `Builder` implementations first, and handle the actual constructor ??? builder migration in a follow-up step. Is this the right approach?


**Third**  
For deprecation comments, I???ll mark the existing constructors as ???will be removed in 4.0??? for consistency across all classes. Please confirm if that???s correct.


Let me know if this approach makes sense, and I???ll proceed accordingly.

@pado0 - I'd suggest pick up the individual classes as separate PRs and do the following:
1/ Create a builder pattern for the inner stats
2/ Mark the constructors as deprecated. 
3/ Migrate (refactor) any earlier usage of constructors to your newly created builder patterns in source/test code.

Having small isolated PRs makes the review quick and easier to merge.

Now coming to the stats classes you listed:

----

Pattern 1: Using Stats as an inner class & exposed as Public API

[IndexStats](https://github.com/opensearch-project/OpenSearch/blob/main/server/src/main/java/org/opensearch/action/admin/indices/stats/IndexStats.java) - This looks abstracted out nicely already with not exposing individual stats. We can leave this as it is for now.

[RemoteTranslogTransferTracker](https://github.com/opensearch-project/OpenSearch/blob/main/server/src/main/java/org/opensearch/index/remote/RemoteTranslogTransferTracker.java) - Its inner stats should actually use a builder pattern.

https://github.com/opensearch-project/OpenSearch/blob/main/server/src/main/java/org/opensearch/index/shard/IndexingStats.java#L191-L246 - didn't see this in your comment but this could definitely use a builder pattern though.

-----

Pattern 2: Using Stats as an inner class & marked as internal API

[CpuUsageTracker](https://github.com/opensearch-project/OpenSearch/blob/main/server/src/main/java/org/opensearch/search/backpressure/trackers/CpuUsageTracker.java)

Given this class is not exposed as a public API, the inner stats using a constructor shouldn't be an issue and can be ignored as of now.

--------

Pattern 3: No inner Stats class, using constructor directly & exposed as Public API

[RefreshStats](https://github.com/opensearch-project/OpenSearch/blob/main/server/src/main/java/org/opensearch/index/refresh/RefreshStats.java)

This definitely needs a builder pattern as any new metrics would require a new constructor.

@sandeshkr419 Thanks for the comments!

I reviewed Cluster / Node / Shard / Indices stats (and other metrics) to see where a Stats class is present,
and grouped all stats-related classes into two patterns that are candidates for introducing the Builder pattern.
All of them are PublicAPI and expose public constructors.

For each class, I will:
1. introduce a Builder,
2. mark existing public constructors as @Deprecated, and
3. refactor usages (including tests) to the new Builder.

The list is sorted by priority, and I???ll open small, isolated PRs per class in that order.
If anything looks off, I???m happy to take feedback on the individual PRs and adjust accordingly.

And feedback at any time is very welcome :) Thank you!

### Pattern 1: Using Stats as an inner class & exposed as Public API
- [x] [IndexingStats.Stats](https://github.com/opensearch-project/OpenSearch/blob/main/server/src/main/java/org/opensearch/index/shard/IndexingStats.java)
- [x] [ThreadPoolStats.Stats](https://github.com/opensearch-project/OpenSearch/blob/main/server/src/main/java/org/opensearch/threadpool/ThreadPoolStats.java)

- [ ] [Condition.Stats](https://github.com/opensearch-project/OpenSearch/blob/main/server/src/main/java/org/opensearch/action/admin/indices/rollover/Condition.java)
- [ ] [DirectoryFileTransferTracker.Stats](https://github.com/opensearch-project/OpenSearch/blob/main/server/src/main/java/org/opensearch/index/store/DirectoryFileTransferTracker.java)

summary.main: The main goal of this issue is to refactor Stats API classes to use the Builder pattern, which will improve backward-compatibility and reduce disruption for developers.
summary.validationOrRequirement: The classes to be actioned are those that expose public constructors and are part of the Public API. The author will group the classes into two patterns: using Stats as an inner class & exposed as Public API, and using constructor directly & exposed as Public API.
summary.attemptedFixes: The author plans to create a builder pattern for each class, mark existing public constructors as deprecated, and refactor usages (including tests) to the new Builder.
summary.otherNotes: The issue is about refactoring Stats API classes to use the Builder pattern instead of constructors, to improve backward-compatibility and reduce disruption for developers.

issueDTO.title: Add an option to use fuzzy match for macro completions too (they currently require an exact prefix match)
issueDTO.description:
Macro completion prompts ignore the macros with the character `_`. For example, `GL_POINT` won't prompt when I type `glp`.
And I suggest changing the macro prompt icon, not use "abc". It's sometimes confused with the "intelligence learning" of the user's code.
And I suggest the macro to expand when code completion expand.

## Example code
**CMake**
```cmake
cmake_minimum_required(VERSION 3.25)
project(app)
set(CMAKE_EXPORT_COMPILE_COMMANDS TRUE)
```
